data.title: Pilgrimage to Vrndavana
data.blurb: In Vrndvana-mahimamrta, Prabhodananda Sarasvati has written:
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
In Vrndvana-mahimamrta, Prabhodananda Sarasvati has written:

"If you desire sense gratification, then why not enjoy the greatest sense gratification, which is available in Vrndavana? If you desire liberation, then know that in Vrndavana you can easily attain liberation without having to suffer many harsh austerities. If you desire devotional service to the Supreme Personality of Godhead, then know that the supreme secret of devotion is hidden in Vrndavana. Learn this from the great devotees, and serve Sri Vrndavana."

It had been too many years since I had been on pilgrimage to Sri Vrndavana Dhama. Desiring to uncover at least some of Vrndavana's "supreme secrets of devotion", this year I made a plan to spend a few days in Vrndavana with my godbrother, Rohini Suta Prabhu.

In October, when my health began troubling me as it often does after an exceptionally intense spring and summer of constant travel, and when I then went to Mayapura for my month-long rest and recuperation, I began to seriously doubt if I would be able to keep my commitment to go to Vrndavana before continuing my journey East, gradually on my way to the United States. However, towards the end of my stay in Mayapura, feeling much better than when I arrived, I recommitted myself to spend those few days in Vrndavana.

During my "surprise" visit, I expressed my mood for coming to disciples who were present in Vrndavana and who were invited to Rohini Suta Prabhu's flat for a short morning program.

Unfortunately, I was not able to secure a recording of that talk. I will therefore attempt to capture the essence of it, and it is as follows:

"Since I have not come to Vrndavana for so long, I knew that if I wanted to get the most of my short visit, I should learn how to enter the dhama by going on parikrama with someone who resides here and who can show by example how to enter."

I then quoted the above verse by Sri Prabhodananda Sarasvati, leaving it up to the listeners to decide for themselves whether sense gratification, liberation, devotional service, or even all three, were motivating factors for coming to Vrndavana. The verse itself even suggests that whatever of those desires are there in our hearts, Vrndavana dhama can fulfill them in a very wonderful way.

"I requested Rohini Suta Prabhu if he would kindly take me on parikrama anywhere in Vrndavana and wherever he wanted to take me. And although I arrived before meeting with all of you, I still wanted to see all of you, to share a few words with all of you, to invite all of you to our short morning program and then to invite you to accompany us on parikrama today.

Having already visited a few tirthas with Rohini Suta Prabhu, including Radha Madana-mohana temple, today we will be taking darshan of Radha Govinda, Radha Syamasundara, Radha Gopinath, Radha Ramana, Radha Gokulananda, Radha Damodara, and we will be ending our parikrama with darshans of Sri Sri Gaura Nitai, Krsna Balarama, Radha Syamasundara, Srila Prabhupada in his samadhi, and Srila Prabhupada's rooms by 11:30 AM so that I can leave for the airport by 12:30 PM to get my flight to Taiwan."

I then spoke individually, but briefly, with a few devotees, we honored prasadam, and we then boarded our previously arranged motor-rickshaws for our parikrama.

There is more I could say about parikrama and the inspiration I felt from having my desires to go on parikrama with Rohini Suta Prabhu fulfilled, but I will simply say that everything went better than I could possibly hope and amazingly, every one of the Deity darshans were open without any interuption.

As I was leaving Krsna Balarama Mandir, at the time we pre-arranged to return to the flat, I turned to Rohini Suta Prabhu and said that I had one serious regret and that was that I wasn't sure if Radha Syamasundar would forgive me for not stopping to see Their servant, a long-time resident of Sri Vrndavana Dhama and my very dear friend, Bhuvaneshvara Prabhu, who has been cooking the raj bhoga offering for the Deities for so many years.

Previously, whenever I visited Vrndanava, I would always visit Bhuvaneshvara Prabhu. He would usually have a huge plate of mahaprasadam from the lunch offering waiting for me so that we could honor lunch together in his room. I was feeling really bad for not stopping to see him and could not relinquish the thought from my mind.

Just at that very moment, as I turned towards the gate, Bhuvaneshvara Prabhu entered the same gate from the alley and was looking at me right in the eyes. I immediately embraced him, told him how I was thinking of him exactly at that moment, and then confessed why I was thinking of him. He simply smiled and we then exchanged a few confidential words about each other and each other's service.

When I asked Bhuvaneshvara prabhu if he was cooking the raj bhoga, he reminded me that Srimati Radharani was always doing the cooking and not him. He then immediately pulled out two sweets wrapped in tin foil that Radharani had prepared and shared one of them with me. I cannot describe how much happiness came into my heart as I embraced Bhuvaneshvara Prabhu once more in gratitude for the mahaprasadam, for the opportunity to see him, and for the realization that Radha Syamasundara made this wonderful arrangement for me so that I wouldn't have to beg Their forgiveness the next time I took Their darshan.

Such are the ways of Sri Vrndavana Dhama. Some of those secrets were being revealed to me by Radha Syamasundara's devotees.

I jumped into the rickshaw, honored a small morsel from the sweet handed to me by Bhuvaneshvara Prabhu, and then distributed a small morsel of the same sweet to each and every devotee who approached me as I was returning to the flat. I thought for sure that there wouldn't be enough sweet to give to everyone. But it was almost as if the sweet was expanding as I was taking each morsel from it in order to provide maha to anyone who would approach me for the mercy. Srimati Radharani was spreading Her mercy, even to me, by giving me the opportunity to share Her mercy with others.

I have some photos to share, though not many. But whatever I have will be posted in the photo section. There is also a small audio clip which Rohini Suta Prabhu took of a very devotional kirtan the Brijbasis were having during our darshan of Radha Govinda. And there is a short video clip of one Brijbasi from Bhandiravana, who was preparing lunch for his deities, which he also wanted to share with us after it was offered. The fresh rotis he prepared, by cooking them directly on the fire, were simply amazing.

Hare Krsna

"Since I have not come to Vrndavana for so long, I knew that if I wanted to get the most of my short visit, I should learn how to enter the dhama by going on parikrama with someone who resides here and who can show by example how to enter."

I then quoted the above verse by Sri Prabhodananda Sarasvati, leaving it up to the listeners to decide for themselves whether sense gratification, liberation, devotional service, or even all three, were motivating factors for coming to Vrndavana. The verse itself even suggests that whatever of those desires are there in our hearts, Vrndavana dhama can fulfill them in a very wonderful way.

"I requested Rohini Suta Prabhu if he would kindly take me on parikrama anywhere in Vrndavana and wherever he wanted to take me. And although I arrived before meeting with all of you, I still wanted to see all of you, to share a few words with all of you, to invite all of you to our short morning program and then to invite you to accompany us on parikrama today.

Having already visited a few tirthas with Rohini Suta Prabhu, including Radha Madana-mohana temple, today we will be taking darshan of Radha Govinda, Radha Syamasundara, Radha Gopinath, Radha Ramana, Radha Gokulananda, Radha Damodara, and we will be ending our parikrama with darshans of Sri Sri Gaura Nitai, Krsna Balarama, Radha Syamasundara, Srila Prabhupada in his samadhi, and Srila Prabhupada's rooms by 11:30 AM so that I can leave for the airport by 12:30 PM to get my flight to Taiwan."

I then spoke individually, but briefly, with a few devotees, we honored prasadam, and we then boarded our previously arranged motor-rickshaws for our parikrama.

There is more I could say about parikrama and the inspiration I felt from having my desires to go on parikrama with Rohini Suta Prabhu fulfilled, but I will simply say that everything went better than I could possibly hope and amazingly, every one of the Deity darshans were open without any interuption.

As I was leaving Krsna Balarama Mandir, at the time we pre-arranged to return to the flat, I turned to Rohini Suta Prabhu and said that I had one serious regret and that was that I wasn't sure if Radha Syamasundar would forgive me for not stopping to see Their servant, a long-time resident of Sri Vrndavana Dhama and my very dear friend, Bhuvaneshvara Prabhu, who has been cooking the raj bhoga offering for the Deities for so many years.

Previously, whenever I visited Vrndanava, I would always visit Bhuvaneshvara Prabhu. He would usually have a huge plate of mahaprasadam from the lunch offering waiting for me so that we could honor lunch together in his room. I was feeling really bad for not stopping to see him and could not relinquish the thought from my mind.

Just at that very moment, as I turned towards the gate, Bhuvaneshvara Prabhu entered the same gate from the alley and was looking at me right in the eyes. I immediately embraced him, told him how I was thinking of him exactly at that moment, and then confessed why I was thinking of him. He simply smiled and we then exchanged a few confidential words about each other and each other's service.

When I asked Bhuvaneshvara prabhu if he was cooking the raj bhoga, he reminded me that Srimati Radharani was always doing the cooking and not him. He then immediately pulled out two sweets wrapped in tin foil that Radharani had prepared and shared one of them with me. I cannot describe how much happiness came into my heart as I embraced Bhuvaneshvara Prabhu once more in gratitude for the mahaprasadam, for the opportunity to see him, and for the realization that Radha Syamasundara made this wonderful arrangement for me so that I wouldn't have to beg Their forgiveness the next time I took Their darshan.

Such are the ways of Sri Vrndavana Dhama. Some of those secrets were being revealed to me by Radha Syamasundara's devotees.

I jumped into the rickshaw, honored a small morsel from the sweet handed to me by Bhuvaneshvara Prabhu, and then distributed a small morsel of the same sweet to each and every devotee who approached me as I was returning to the flat. I thought for sure that there wouldn't be enough sweet to give to everyone. But it was almost as if the sweet was expanding as I was taking each morsel from it in order to provide maha to anyone who would approach me for the mercy. Srimati Radharani was spreading Her mercy, even to me, by giving me the opportunity to share Her mercy with others.

I have some photos to share, though not many. But whatever I have will be posted in the photo section. There is also a small audio clip which Rohini Suta Prabhu took of a very devotional kirtan the Brijbasis were having during our darshan of Radha Govinda. And there is a short video clip of one Brijbasi from Bhandiravana, who was preparing lunch for his deities, which he also wanted to share with us after it was offered. The fresh rotis he prepared, by cooking them directly on the fire, were simply amazing.

Hare Krsna

data.title: Update
data.blurb: Now that my stay in Mayapura is gradually coming to a close, I thought I should provide a short follow-up to my October 20th blog about my health and the purpose for which I came to Mayapura after the GBC meetings.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
Now that my stay in Mayapura is gradually coming to a close, I thought I should provide a short follow-up to my October 20th blog about my health and the purpose for which I came to Mayapura after the GBC meetings.

At first I was little hesitant about cancelling my visit to the Ayurvedic clinic. During this time of the year, I've spent three weeks in the clinic for the past three years in a row. These visits have helped to, at least, stabilize my health enough to allow me to continue to travel.

So it was a bit of risk, but I'm pleased to report that right now it looks as though the medicine I'm taking, the regulation I've been able to maintain, the rest, the exercise, the atmosphere, the association, and especially the Kartika vrata I was able to follow (which I would have never been able to follow in the clinic) have all brought results as good as, if not better, than if I would have gone to the clinic.

I see no need to go into details about my health, except to say that both my digestion (which was getting quite bad) and my back (which was the worst it's been in several years) are much better than when I arrived. In fact this was the first time I've been able to do my back exercises daily for over two years.

I would like to take this opportunity to thank all the devotees in Mayapura (too many to list individually) who facilitated this retreat for me in the Holy Dham. Not only do I thank those devotees who directly facilitated, but so many devotees also indirectly helped me, by encouraging me to to stick to my goals throughout my entire stay here in Mayapura.

After Kartika was over, I felt better enough to begin scheduling short meetings each day before my evening readings. So although I did not do any programs, by Krsna's grace, I was able to spend time individually with over twenty devotees and many families too, who would have ordinarily attended a program if it would have been organized.

I had put together a list to meet even more than I did, but unfortunately the time did not allow me to schedule everyone with whom I wanted to meet.

Still, having felt the support of every one of those who did come to see me, I feel more hopeful than ever that devotees, either staying in or visiting Mayapura, are taking shelter of the dhama, the Vaisnavas, the holy name, and whatever little I have to offer to them.

In this connection, the other evening during our readings, Devamrita Maharaja read one quote from Srila Prabhupada to Sivarama Maharaja and myself, which I find relevant to quote on this particular point.

Srila Prabhupada was on a walk here in Mayapura, and upon hearing the kirtan party in the background he said:

Srila Prabhupada: That is our purpose, that Europeans and Americans will come, and they will dance here with the chanting, 'Jaya Sacinandana!' So that is being done.

Indian devotee: That is being done. By the mercy of Prabhupada Maharaja, everything has become possible.

Srila Prabhupada: So when they chant and dance, I simply remember Bhaktivinoda Thakura. That's all. I pray to Bhaktivinoda Thakura, "Now they have come to your shelter. Give them protection." That's all. What can I do more? I cannot do anything more. [end of quote]

I am also praying to Srila Prabhupada in a similar way. "Please give them protection." What can I do more?

Hare Krsna

data.title: How to Chant the Holy Name
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
The evening before Sivarama Swami, Devamrita Swami and myself were having our usual evening reading and discussion (soon to be posted). While discussing a topic related to the holy name, I remembered one verse from Padyavali, part of which I used to quote from time to time and quoted it for them. Unknown to me, the next day Sivarama Maharaja began looking for the verse under the verses he had from Padyavali specifically related to the holy name, but was unable to find it.

Last night I found the verse and sent it to Sivarama Maharaja. His response to me was "Fantastic!"

While chanting japa this morning, I began meditating on that verse and couldn't resist sharing it with all of you.

But first, in order to best prepare you for the actual verse, I will cite the first verse of Padyavali written by Srila Rupa Goswami himself.

Text 1
padyavali viracita rasikair mukunda-
sambandha-bandhura-pada pramadormi-sindhuh
ramya samasta-tamasam damani kramena
sangrhyate krti-kadambaka-kautukaya

Translation
This Padyavali (Anthology of Poetry) was written by devotees expert in the mellows of devotional service. This book contains many beautiful verses, which have been collected for the pleasure of the devotees. It illuminates the darkness of ignorance, and it is an ocean of transcendental bliss.
-- Sri Rupa Gosvami

I first quoted the verse above to give some understanding of what Rupa Goswami's Padyavali contains. Many of the verses he collected were written by authors unknown. 

In the book "Gaudiya Vaisnava Samadhis in Vrndavana", Mahanidhi Swami writes:

"During the sixteenth century, entire books of exceptional transcendental prose and poetry were penned by prideless Vaisnavas preferring to remain anonymous. Feeling utmost humility, such Vaisnava writers express themselves only in relation to their preceptors."

Such is the case with the verse under discussion. Here is the verse:

Text 93
asvadyam pramada-rada-cchadam iva sravyam navam jalpitam
balaya iva drsya uttama-vadhu-lavanya-laksmir iva
prodghosyam cira-viprayukta-vanita-sandesa-vaniva me
naivedyam caritam ca rupam anisam sri-krsna namastu te

Translation
O Lord Krsna, I pray that the remnants of Your food may become as palatable to me as a young woman's lips are to her beloved. I pray that the narration of Your pastimes may become as sweet to my ears as the words of a young girl are to her beloved. I pray that the sight of Your transcendental form may become as pleasing to my eyes as the beauty of a young bride is to her husband. And I pray that I may always chant Your holy name with the same eagerness that a lover reads aloud a letter from his long-separated beloved.
  -- author unknown

Hare Krsna

data.title: Surabhi Kunj and Svananda Sukhada Kunj
data.blurb: Today Devamrita Maharaja, Vraja Kumar dasa, Karabhajana dasa, Dhruva Maharaja dasa, and myself went on a short parikrama across the Jalangi to Svananda Sukhada Kunj, the house of Srila Bhaktivinode Thakur and then Surabhi Kunj.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
Today Devamrita Maharaja, Vraja Kumar dasa, Karabhajana dasa, Dhruva Maharaja dasa, and myself went on a short parikrama across the Jalangi to Svananda Sukhada Kunj, the house of Srila Bhaktivinode Thakur and then Surabhi Kunj.

First we took darshan of Bhaktivinode Thakur's Samadhi, his personal Deities of Sri Gauranga Mahaprabhu and Sri Gadadhara Pandit, and the bhajan kutir of Srila Gaura Kisora das Babaji Maharaja.

Devamrita Maharaja read from Saranagati of Srila Bhaktivinode Thakur and then we chanted the bhajan, Sri Godruma Candra Bhajana-Upadesa.

From there we walked to Surabhi Kunj where we were enthusiastically greeted by one Vaisnava sannyasi who gave us a tour of the new temple which was constructed in Surabhi Kunj. We were told that the grand opening was this year's Gaura Purnima festival. I was very impressed, since last year it was just in it's early stages of construction. But now there is a very beautiful temple where the simple construction site was last year.

There we continued our readings in Saranagati, chanted Boro Sukher Khabor Gai, and we were then invited to honor some mahaprasadam while we had a pleasant exchange with our host who said that he was very happy to have Vaisnava sanga with us.

It was the first parikrama I went on since I arrived in Mayapura. I did not plan to go on parikrama at all this year, especially since my priority this year was to observe my Kartika vrata. The reason was that the last three years I had to spend most of Kartika in the Ayurvedic clinic. I was therefore eager to accept some personal vrata this year and I can say that I'm very happy I did.

I was also happy to go on parikrama today. I'm not sure if we'll go again before I leave, but it was well worth the trip across the Jalangi. In the same mood as our host in Surabhi Kunj, I was very happy to have the Vaisnava sanga.

Hare Krsna

data.title: Srinathji dasa's Memorial Service at Radha Gopinath Mandir
data.blurb: Due to the time I invested in my vrata during Kartika this year, I am just now getting the opportunity to work on matters related to this site.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
Due to the time I invested in my vrata during Kartika this year, I am just now getting the opportunity to work on matters related to this site.

Soon two audio files will be posted. While I was in Mumbai for the GBC meetings, I received news that Srinathji dasa, a devotee from Radha Gopinath Mandir and a highly respected devotee all over ISKCON, departed from this world on a visit to Bhutan. Although I was aware that many years ago he had a heart attack, a major heart surgery, and that he never really fully recovered, still, he was so vibrant and energetic whenever I met with him that I didn't expect his sudden departure.

As you will hear in my eulogy, I had great respect for Srinathji Prabhu and since I know practically all of his family members, I excused myself from the GBC meetings to go to his home for the performance of his last rites. Immediately thereafter his body was taken to the crematorium.

Several days later, a memorial service was scheduled on Sunday afternoon by his family at Radha Gopinath Mandir. I excused myself once again from the GBC meetings in order to attend the memorial service. In my tribute it will be explained why I did not attend the meetings and then go later to the memorial service as other GBC members did. I arrived before the memorial service began so that I could hear all the eulogies, especially those from his family members.

Unfortunately, the audio files which were made available were not very high quality. There was a loud humming sound throughout most of the talks due to some interference in the sound system.

An extract of my talk was taken from the four and a half hour recording and an attempt was made to clean the file to remove as much noise as possible. The main file, however, was not cleaned. Still, all the talks can be heard without difficulty. If you can tolerate the humming sound, I highly recommend that you listen to the eulogies spoken about Srinathji Prabhu. He was a very wonderful Vaisnava.

Hare Krsna

data.title: Fourteen Days Left until the End of Kartik
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
While on a walk with Sivarama Maharaja a couple of days ago, he asked me how my Kartik vrata was going. Maharaja asked because I've been rising between 12:00 and 12:30 AM every morning since arriving and I immediately begin chanting japa until breakfast, after which I continue chanting for some time.

I told him that it was nice opportunity and it made me reminiscent of the time, about ten years ago, when I was on a leave of absence and was able to chant a lot of extra rounds every day for almost eighteen months.

Maharaja then paraphrased the verse from Sixth Canto Srimad Bhagavatam, quoted as follows:

mriyamano harer nama
grnan putropacaritam
ajamilo 'py agad dhama
kim uta sraddhaya grnan

TRANSLATION
While suffering at the time of death, Ajamila chanted the holy name of the Lord, and although the chanting was directed toward his son, he nevertheless returned home, back to Godhead. Therefore if one faithfully and inoffensively chants the holy name of the Lord, where is the doubt that he will return to Godhead?

It was an encouraging paraphrase, but when I returned and actually read it, I took note of the words "faithfully and inoffensively." I hope to work on that while I'm here too.

data.blurb: I arrived in Mumbai from Budapest at 1:00 AM on October 14th morning. I have been here in Mumbai since then, attending the GBC Midterm meetings scheduled from October 15 - 24.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
I arrived in Mumbai from Budapest at 1:00 AM on October 14th morning. I have been here in Mumbai since then, attending the GBC Midterm meetings scheduled from October 15 - 24.

Along with our daily meetings from 10 AM - 6:30 PM, I've also visited two doctors (one Ayurvedic, the other Allopathic) in order to identify the cause of the stomach pains I've been dealing with since early September.

For now, I've chosen to follow the recommendations given by the Ayurvedic doctor. He put me on a course of medication and has given me a diet even more strict than the one I've already been following.

Another strong recommendation given to me was to stay in one place for some time so that I can regulate my daily regimen with rest, medication, appropriate exercise, and to stay away from flying in order to get the most benefit from the medication and diet he's given to me.

For the past three years I've spent three weeks after the GBC meetings at an Ayurvedic clinic. However, this year I had no plan to go to the clinic because I got some fairly good results last year. Now that stomach problems have surfaced again, I've chosen this approach this year.

Hence, after Mumbai I will go directly to Mayapura, where I will fully withdraw for a minimum of one month.

To "fully withdraw" means that I will not attend any programs, I will not accept any invitations, I will not give any classes, I will not have any meetings, and I will not answer any email. I hope for everyone's cooperation in this regard. I sense that my body is trying to tell me that I've been abusing it with all of this travel. 

I am therefore appealing to everyone who reads this blog to please take advantage of all that's been made available to you on this site. Please also take advantage of the books which have been made available. During this time, I also hope to move some new book projects along and to review some transcripts for publishing on the site, something I've been neglecting for the past few years.

If anyone wishes to write reports, you may send reports through the authorized reporting system. I will continue to read any report sent to me. But please, do not include any medical advice.

Finally, I will try my best to post regular blogs during the month of November to compensate for the fact that I will otherwise be unavailable for anything else during that time.

Thank you for your understanding.

Hare Krsna

data.title: The Passing of Gopana Daksa devi dasi
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
This morning I received news that one of my early disciples, formerly from Ukraine, Gopana Daksa devi dasi, left this world in Vrndavana at 15:15, yesterday, September 13, 2016. She was a very serious and sincere disciple, who always displayed great determination in her spiritual life since the day I first met her in the early 1990's. She relocated to Vrndavana many years ago, and for years, every year she would send me the results of her book distribution efforts. She had great faith in the holy name and in distributing Srila Prabhupada's books.

In April of this year, when I was first informed about Gopana Daksa devi dasi's declining health, she sent the following message to me through another devotee in Vrndavana:

"When she gets easier, she thinks that she should go on sankirtana, but for her it became difficult to do because it takes a lot of energy and efforts. Therefore Gopana daksha mataji is asking your permission to suspend sankirtana service for the while. Also she asks your blessings for a quick recovery. Please accept her humble obeisances."

Despite the fact that her hemoglobin count was seriously low, that she had already had several blood transfusions, that she had to spend so much time in the hospital, and that the possibility of having leukemia was lurking in the background while waiting for test results, Gopana Daksha was still asking permission if she could temporarily suspend book distribution. She was that much determined.

For her sincere efforts in devotional service, Krsna blessed her with the opportunity to leave her body in Vrndavana, in full consciousness, calling out Krsna's name with her final breath. We pray for her smooth journey back home, to the lotus feet of Sri Sri Radha Syamasundara.

Hare Krsna

data.blurb:
During the questions and answers sessions, I read the following quotes from Caitanya Bhagavata. When I was asked for the references, I said I would post them in a blog. For those who are interested, here they are:

Sri Caitanya Bhagavata, Madhya Khanda, Chapter Five
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
During the questions and answers sessions, I read the following quotes from Caitanya Bhagavata. When I was asked for the references, I said I would post them in a blog. For those who are interested, here they are:

Sri Caitanya Bhagavata, Madhya Khanda, Chapter Five

TEXT 140-141

vaisnava-himsara katha se thakuka dure
sahaja jivere ye adhama pida kare

visnu pujiya o ye prajara pida kare
puja o nisphale yaya, ara duhkhe mare

What to speak of being envious of the Vaisnavas, if one causes pain to ordinary living entities he is considered a fallen low-class person. Even after worshiping Lord Visnu, if a person gives trouble to other living entities, his worship becomes fruitless. Such a person suffers unlimited miseries.
If a person is knowingly or unknowingly envious of a Vaisnava who is engaged in the nonduplicitous service of Lord Hari, his degradation is inevitable. Of this there is no doubt. Apart from this, if even persons claiming to be devotees of Visnu are envious of ordinary living entities and give various troubles to them, they are actually far away from devotional service to Visnu and are not fit to be called human beings. Their worship of Visnu becomes the source of misery. Those endowed with an absense of jive-daya, or compassion for other living entities, and yet proudly consider themselves servants of Lord Visnu achieve the threefold miseries rather than the devotional service of the Lord.


Sri Caitanya Bhagavata, Madhya Khanda, Chapter 19

207-Text 208
"Everyone please give your thoughts to Me. Please hear the truth I will now say. Anyone who neglects My servant and then worships Me is very lowly and degraded. Such a person cuts Me into pieces. His worship is like fire burning My body.
Text 209
"My holy name, which is a kalpa-vrksa tree, destroys anyone who once blasphemes My servant.
Text 210
"The living entities who live in the numberless universes are all My servants. Therefore any living entity who harms another living entity will perish.
Text 211
"You are more dear to Me than My own body. Anyone who offends You will not be able to bear the fate that waits for him.
Text 212
"If a sannyasi blasphemes an innocent person, the sannyasi will fall down. All his piety will perish."
Text 213
Raising His arms, fair Lord Caitanya declared to the entire world, "Renouncing criticism of others, everyone please chant Lord Krsna's name.
Text 214
"I will personally deliver anyone who does not criticize others and who once chants `Krsna!' That is the truth. It is the truth."
Text 215
When Lord Caitanya spoke these words, the devotees responded with "Jaya! Jaya! Jaya!"

data.title: This Year's Vyasa Puja Offering to Srila Prabhupada
data.blurb:
Dear Srila Prabhupada,

Please accept my prostrated obeisances in the dust of your divine lotus feet. All glories to Your Divine Grace.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
Dear Srila Prabhupada,

Please accept my prostrated obeisances in the dust of your divine lotus feet. All glories to Your Divine Grace.

Another year has already passed since the last time I read my offering before you on this most auspicious day of your divine appearance in this world. Each year brings new opportunities to glorify you throughout the year, and with that, new realizations of your infinite glories.

Last week in Ticino, Switzerland, I watched a video of your disciple, Guru Gauranga dasa, delivering an audio-visual presentation in Boston at the 50th anniversary of your arrival in Boston. His captivating and well-researched presentation was entitled "A Most Improbable Journey." Although I was present when he first delivered his detailed account of your journey from Calcutta to Boston, and then on to New York, it wasn't until Ticino that I looked more deeply at your diary entry on September 10, 1965, entered as follows:

"Today the ship is plying very smoothly. I feel today better. But I am feeling separation from Sri Vrindaban and my Lords Sri Govinda, Gopinath, Radha Damodar. The only solace is Sri Chaitanya Charitamrita in which I am tasting the nectarine of Lord Chaitanya's Leela. I have left Bharat Bhumi just to execute the order of Sri Bhakti Siddhanta Saraswati in pursuance of Lord Chaitanya's order. I have no qualification, but I have taken up the risk just to carry out the order of His Divine Grace. I depend fully on Their mercy so far away from Vrindaban."

I've read this before… in fact… so many times. But this time these words struck me with yet another one of the numerous confirmations I've discovered in service to you of how you were thinking then and throughout your divine lila of rescuing conditioned souls. Soon thereafter you would attempt to teach each and every one of your future disciples through your books, lectures and by your perfect example this very same principle of full submission to the Lord and His pure representative.

Of course, the depth of your teachings can never be limited to only one method for realizing pure devotional service. As our founder-acarya, your pure example teaches all facets of Krsna consciousness to the highest degree. However, it is this particular quality in you which deeply captivates me, so much so that I find myself reflecting on it wherever I see it throughout all of your teachings.

I know only too well how unqualified I am. In order to teach us everything by your example, therefore, for our sake, you consistently took the position of one who was not qualified even though you were the most qualified. This principle, demonstrated by your perfect example, gives me hope that fully serving you and some day even satisfying you, remains possible despite living in physical separation from you.

I remember the first time I read your concluding words upon completing your translation of "Sri Caitanya Caritamrita"… that same solace you wrote about in your journal while crossing the Atlantic Ocean. I clearly remember feeling overwhelmed by the devotion, humility, faith, submission, and transparency which you perfectly conveyed to your followers:

" I think that His Divine Grace Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati Thakura is always seeing my activities and guiding me within my heart by his words. As it is said in Srimad-Bhagavatam, tene brahma hrda ya adi-kavaye [SB 1.1.1]. Spiritual inspiration comes from within the heart, wherein the Supreme Personality of Godhead, in His Paramatma feature, is always sitting with all His devotees and associates. It is to be admitted that whatever translation work I have done is through the inspiration of my spiritual master, because personally I am most insignificant and incompetent to do this materially impossible work. I do not think myself a very learned scholar, but I have full faith in the service of my spiritual master, His Divine Grace Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati Thakura. If there is any credit to my activities of translating, it is all due to His Divine Grace."

I can no longer count the number of times I have read these concluding words. They are a constant reminder to me of the need to more deeply realize my own lack of qualification and thus develop an increasingly helpless dependence on everything you attempted to teach us when you were with us.

Not long thereafter, more than thirty years ago, when faced with the "then" daunting responsibilities I had as temple president, I discovered another very similar clue which you had given in Srimad Bhagavatam for carrying out the heavy duties you entrusted to me. While reading Brahma's prayers for creative potency, I read in one of your purports:

"Any person authorized by either the Lord or by His bona fide representative is already blessed, as is the work entrusted to him. Of course, the person entrusted with such a responsibility should always be aware of his incapability and must always look for the mercy of the Lord for the successful execution of his duty. One should not be puffed up because he is entrusted with certain executive work. Fortunate is he who is so entrusted, and if he is always fixed in the sense of being subordinate to the will of the Supreme, he is sure to come out successful in the discharge of his work." (purport - SB 3.9.29)

That one purport saved me in times of deep desparation. Countless times I have read this purport and I continue to share it with devotees as a divine sutra "to come out successful" in all one's spiritual endeavors.

When I was visiting the Bhaktivedanta Archives many years ago, your disciple, Ranjhit dasa, shared the original copy of your 1966 New York journal with me which he had just recently acquired from one of your early disciples. I asked him if I could take it into the other room and read it for awhile. He kindly agreed and I disappeared into the next room to scour through all of your entries. It was then that I took note of another diary entry dated February 3, 1966:

"Today there was a very nice demonstration of tape-record Samkirtan by me.

It is all Grace of Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. Srila Haridas Thakur said that the transcendental sound of Hari Nama would even purify the heart of birds and beasts. Today this statement of Thakur Haridas is corroborated. These American can not understand even a word's meaning of the Sankirtan and yet they were so much attracted? It is all Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's power; there is no credit for me."

I sat there captivated, tears coming from my eyes, appreciating these words so much, as testimony to your compassion, humility, and exclusive dependence on the mercy bestowed upon you from your worshipable Lord and divine masters. I immediately returned to Ranjhit Prabhu to share my discovery and then asked him for a pen and paper to write them down for my own personal safekeeping and as a constant reminder on how to render devotional service.

Actually, this mood, example and instruction is revealed unlimitedly by you, as well as in the thousands of testimonies your disciples have given based on what they personally heard from you and how they also had seen these qualities in you. Every moment you were present with us there was an instruction and example of surrender in full Krsna consciousness. You fully embodied the mood of humility in submission to the divine order coming both from within and without.

Lord Krsna Himself declared to Arjuna:

"In all activities just depend upon Me and work always under My protection. In such devotional service, be fully conscious of Me. If you become conscious of Me, you will pass over all the obstacles of conditioned life by My grace. If, however, you do not work in such consciousness but act through false ego, not hearing Me, you will be lost."

Srila Prabhupada, on this most auspicious day of your divine appearance, I humbly fall at your lotus feet and beg you to continue to help me always be fully conscious of you. One may ask,
"Why 'you' and not Krsna?" Again, because you revealed another clue which I constantly remember in the most difficult of times:

"...if a disciple is very serious to execute the mission of the spiritual master, he immediately associates with the Supreme Personality of Godhead by vani or vapuh. This is the only secret of success in seeing the Supreme Personality of Godhead. Instead of being eager to see the Lord in some bush of Vrndavana while at the same time engaging in sense gratification, if one instead sticks to the principle of following the words of the spiritual master, he will see the Supreme Lord without difficulty."

Srila Prabhupada, you are my only hope. It is my realization now, more than ever, that without remembering you, surely I will be lost.

In the dust of your lotus feet,

Your eternal servant,

Niranjana Swami

In order to teach us everything by your example, therefore, for our sake, you consistently took the position of one who was not qualified even though you were the most qualified. This principle, demonstrated by your perfect example, gives me hope that fully serving you and some day even satisfying you, remains possible despite living in physical separation from you.

I remember the first time I read your concluding words upon completing your translation of "Sri Caitanya Caritamrita"… that same solace you wrote about in your journal while crossing the Atlantic Ocean. I clearly remember feeling overwhelmed by the devotion, humility, faith, submission, and transparency which you perfectly conveyed to your followers:

" I think that His Divine Grace Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati Thakura is always seeing my activities and guiding me within my heart by his words. As it is said in Srimad-Bhagavatam, tene brahma hrda ya adi-kavaye [SB 1.1.1]. Spiritual inspiration comes from within the heart, wherein the Supreme Personality of Godhead, in His Paramatma feature, is always sitting with all His devotees and associates. It is to be admitted that whatever translation work I have done is through the inspiration of my spiritual master, because personally I am most insignificant and incompetent to do this materially impossible work. I do not think myself a very learned scholar, but I have full faith in the service of my spiritual master, His Divine Grace Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati Thakura. If there is any credit to my activities of translating, it is all due to His Divine Grace."

I can no longer count the number of times I have read these concluding words. They are a constant reminder to me of the need to more deeply realize my own lack of qualification and thus develop an increasingly helpless dependence on everything you attempted to teach us when you were with us.

Not long thereafter, more than thirty years ago, when faced with the "then" daunting responsibilities I had as temple president, I discovered another very similar clue which you had given in Srimad Bhagavatam for carrying out the heavy duties you entrusted to me. While reading Brahma's prayers for creative potency, I read in one of your purports:

"Any person authorized by either the Lord or by His bona fide representative is already blessed, as is the work entrusted to him. Of course, the person entrusted with such a responsibility should always be aware of his incapability and must always look for the mercy of the Lord for the successful execution of his duty. One should not be puffed up because he is entrusted with certain executive work. Fortunate is he who is so entrusted, and if he is always fixed in the sense of being subordinate to the will of the Supreme, he is sure to come out successful in the discharge of his work." (purport - SB 3.9.29)

That one purport saved me in times of deep desparation. Countless times I have read this purport and I continue to share it with devotees as a divine sutra "to come out successful" in all one's spiritual endeavors.

When I was visiting the Bhaktivedanta Archives many years ago, your disciple, Ranjhit dasa, shared the original copy of your 1966 New York journal with me which he had just recently acquired from one of your early disciples. I asked him if I could take it into the other room and read it for awhile. He kindly agreed and I disappeared into the next room to scour through all of your entries. It was then that I took note of another diary entry dated February 3, 1966:

"Today there was a very nice demonstration of tape-record Samkirtan by me.

It is all Grace of Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu. Srila Haridas Thakur said that the transcendental sound of Hari Nama would even purify the heart of birds and beasts. Today this statement of Thakur Haridas is corroborated. These American can not understand even a word's meaning of the Sankirtan and yet they were so much attracted? It is all Sri Chaitanya Mahaprabhu's power; there is no credit for me."

I sat there captivated, tears coming from my eyes, appreciating these words so much, as testimony to your compassion, humility, and exclusive dependence on the mercy bestowed upon you from your worshipable Lord and divine masters. I immediately returned to Ranjhit Prabhu to share my discovery and then asked him for a pen and paper to write them down for my own personal safekeeping and as a constant reminder on how to render devotional service.

Actually, this mood, example and instruction is revealed unlimitedly by you, as well as in the thousands of testimonies your disciples have given based on what they personally heard from you and how they also had seen these qualities in you. Every moment you were present with us there was an instruction and example of surrender in full Krsna consciousness. You fully embodied the mood of humility in submission to the divine order coming both from within and without.

Lord Krsna Himself declared to Arjuna:

"In all activities just depend upon Me and work always under My protection. In such devotional service, be fully conscious of Me. If you become conscious of Me, you will pass over all the obstacles of conditioned life by My grace. If, however, you do not work in such consciousness but act through false ego, not hearing Me, you will be lost."

Srila Prabhupada, on this most auspicious day of your divine appearance, I humbly fall at your lotus feet and beg you to continue to help me always be fully conscious of you. One may ask,
"Why 'you' and not Krsna?" Again, because you revealed another clue which I constantly remember in the most difficult of times:

"...if a disciple is very serious to execute the mission of the spiritual master, he immediately associates with the Supreme Personality of Godhead by vani or vapuh. This is the only secret of success in seeing the Supreme Personality of Godhead. Instead of being eager to see the Lord in some bush of Vrndavana while at the same time engaging in sense gratification, if one instead sticks to the principle of following the words of the spiritual master, he will see the Supreme Lord without difficulty."

Srila Prabhupada, you are my only hope. It is my realization now, more than ever, that without remembering you, surely I will be lost.

In the dust of your lotus feet,

Your eternal servant,

Niranjana Swami

data.title: Bhakti Sangama Festival – August 29 – September 3 (Discontinued)
data.blurb: This is an announcement regarding my participation in this year's Bhakti Sangama Festival in Ukraine from August 29 – September 3.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
This is an announcement regarding my participation in this year's Bhakti Sangama Festival in Ukraine from August 29 – September 3.

Although I will not be giving a seminar in the main pandal this year, I will conduct daily gatherings with disciples and aspiring disciples for four days in one of the designated seminar venues. The gatherings will begin on August 31st and will continue through September 3rd.

The topic will be "Questions and Answers." Any disciple or aspiring disciple can submit up to three questions in the form below. Your questions will be translated into English (if necessary) and compiled into the list of questions I will be answering during these four days.

In order to have your question included in the list, you must provide your name and city of residence in the form.

However, it is important to note that your name will be known only to the devotees assigned to receive, compile, and translate the questions as they are submitted. No one's name will be read along with the questions at the Bhakti Sangama Festival.

Questions will be prioritized in the following order:

1) Relevancy - based upon lectures and themes I have been speaking on in 2016.

2) Disciples and aspiring disciples present at the festival. (The term "disciples" includes initiated devotees who have formally accepted a siksha relationship.)

3) Disciples not present at the festival.

4) Aspiring disciples not present at the festival.

5) Those who are not in categories 2 – 4 listed above, may submit questions, but since the gatherings are primarily for disciples and aspiring disciples, these questions are less likely to be answered.

Please forward this blog (which can be downloaded below) to any disciple or aspiring disciple you know who you believe may be interested in submitting a question.

However, please also inform the same devotee that questions can be submitted only from within this blog. Questions from any other source will not be accepted.

Hare Krsna

data.title: New Website for Mailorder and Digital Media
data.blurb: I would like to take this opportunity to inform everyone that a new website has been set up for the mailorder of English books, the mailorder of Russian books, digital downloads of ebooks (English and Russian) and digital downloads of studio recordings, including the "Krsna Bhajans" CD series.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
I would like to take this opportunity to inform everyone that a new website has been set up for the mailorder of English books, the mailorder of Russian books, digital downloads of ebooks (English and Russian) and digital downloads of studio recordings, including the "Krsna Bhajans" CD series.

Everything is now available at http://niranjanaswami.com.

In this connection, I have the following humble request:

1) Mailorder books and ebooks continue to be sold at the lowest price possible. I would like to remind everyone that "Gauranga Press" continues to function on a volunteer basis. This means that nobody gets compensated for their services (i.e. for transcribing, editing, proofreading, layout, book production, and sales). Whatever price is set for books and ebooks, is meant to cover the cost of printing, shipping, reprinting, and for printing new books in the future. Please, therefore, be conscientious of this when downloading digital media and do not distribute the downloaded material to others.

2) Regarding the music CD's, there were significant expenses for the recording, mixing, and mastering, of the "Just Chant!" studio recordings. The "Extended Play" (EP) CD, consisting of three tracks, was already released a few years ago, and the new "Just Chant!" Double Album, consisting of ten tracks, will be released this summer on a USB drive (see below).

Prior to the "Just Chant!" productions, all the previous CD's were recorded, mixed, mastered, and produced on a volunteer basis. The income from all the previous CD's covered the cost of almost all of the expenses related to the recording, mixing, and mastering, of the "Just Chant" (EP) CD's and the new Double Album. All additional income from the sale of these CD's was donated to the "ISKCON Youth Ministry", under the care of Manorama dasa, in order to sponsor youths who cannot afford to take part in the annual "Youth Bus Tours."

The "ISKCON Youth Ministry" will continue to be the only beneficiary from the sale of all CD's including the new "Just Chant!" Double Album. The same humble request, therefore, applies to all of these digital recordings. Please do not redistribute any of these digital recordings after purchasing them.

Thank you very much.

Hare Krsna

data.title: Daily Sadhana Sheet Update
data.blurb:
Daily Sadhana Sheet Update

I would like to briefly share my impression of the way the "Daily Sadhana Sheet" has been used since it was first made available about five months ago.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
Daily Sadhana Sheet Update

I would like to briefly share my impression of the way the "Daily Sadhana Sheet" has been used since it was first made available about five months ago.

Currently, thirty-three devotees have their own "Daily Sadhana Sheet" online. Of those thirty-three devotees, twenty-seven of them are providing daily statistics, two of them started to fill out statistics but stopped completely shortly after they started, four of them never started at all for reasons unknown, and fortunately, only one of them seems to be using it for reasons other than keeping records of one's daily sadhana practices.

In addition, approximately ten devotees had an account but their account was removed because it was not being used.

My purpose for providing this facility was manifold:

1) to give devotees struggling with sadhana the opportunity to become more accountable for their sadhana practices,

2) to give devotees struggling with sadhana the opportunity to keep a record of their own performance in order to better see for themselves where they are lacking and where they need to improve,

3) to encourage devotees who either were or currently are struggling to come up to the prescribed standards, to maintain steadiness… even if it's to a lesser standard,

4) to encourage devotees to increase whenever they feel they have the strength and commitment to do so,

5) to encourage devotees with their sadhana in general, simply by providing this extra facility for accountability,

6) to give initiated devotees a private venue to disclose that they are not able to maintain his/her vow to chant sixteen rounds daily,

7) to help initiated devotees better deal with any possible guilt they may have for their inability to maintain their sixteen rounds,

8) to help devotees feel a closer connection between their sadhana and their service to their spiritual master(s),

9) and to show that I understand the struggles devotees encounter with their japa, especially devotees who are not living either in, or near to a temple.

There are probably, even more, reasons I could give, but for now, these are the ones which seem most important to me.

Since I regularly review all of these sadhana sheets and because I plan to continue to do so, then naturally I cannot open this facility up to hundreds of devotees. To do so would create the risk of being unable to monitor everyone's sheet.

However, I am encouraged by the fact that devotees are taking advantage of this facility and naturally I am also encouraged when I get reports of how this facility has encouraged them as well.

Therefore, I am now ready to open this facility up to more devotees.

Without knowing how many new accounts will be requested, I will not set a limit yet. But everyone who signs up should know that it's unlikely that all requests will be promptly fulfilled. It may take time before there is an opening for all who have requested.

Previously the following were the five conditions which had to be met before requesting a daily sadhana sheet:

1) Struggling with sadhana (unable to maintain vow of 16 rounds/daily)
2) There must be a strong desire to gradually improve.
3) Must be honest with his/her entries
4) Must make entries every day
5) Must not use the daily sadhana sheet for anything other than reporting daily sadhana

All of the above still apply, especially #5. If anyone is found to be using their daily sadhana sheet for anything other than for reporting one's daily sadhana, the administrator has been instructed to close their account without notice.

However, I am ready to adjust the first condition (#1) and will now also allow devotees who are chanting 16 rounds daily, to request a sadhana sheet if it encourages them to do so.

To sign up for a daily sadhana sheet simply provide the information required in the form below.

 

 

Signup for Sadhana Sheet

* indicates required

data.title: Health Update
data.blurb: I believe that it has already become known to many that I've rescheduled my departure to the United States from Tuesday, March 29th to tomorrow, Sunday, March 27th. For those who do not know, or for those who do know but may not know why, there is a simple explanation.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
I believe that it has already become known to many that I've rescheduled my departure to the United States from Tuesday, March 29th to tomorrow, Sunday, March 27th. For those who do not know, or for those who do know but may not know why, there is a simple explanation.

Yesterday I saw another ENT specialist. This doctor wanted to take a throat culture, to make sure there is no serious bacterial infection. She said that there is an infection but without a test there would be no way to know if it's a bacterial infection or a viral infection. The treatments are quite different. The problem is that the results of the culture would not be available until after Tuesday, the day I was scheduled to depart.

Moreover, this doctor was insistent that I should not even think of talking for at least several more days. She gave a strong warning that soft talking was even more harmful than regular talking. Having experience with these matters before, I was already aware of the warnings she gave me.

Hence, since I cannot talk anyway, there was really nothing I could accomplish by staying in Kiev. It made more sense to return to the United States tomorrow. An appointment has already been scheduled for taking a throat culture in the New York area on Monday morning at 10:00 AM.  I can get the results more quickly and then follow-up on the results with the same doctor (should there be a need to deal with a bacterial infection).

I again apologize for leaving without fulfilling many devotees' expectations, but in this case, there is nothing I could do to avoid this outcome. To stay and to not heed the doctors' warnings would make recovery time much longer with the risk of serious damage to the vocal chords.

I am scheduled to return to Kiev in early May.

Hare Krsna

data.title: I currently have no voice at all
data.blurb: I came down with a bad cold about three weeks ago, which subsequently started giving me other problems. This was the main reason why I could not take part in the Kirtan Mela this year in Mayapura. I missed three of the four days I was scheduled to lead kirtans.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
I came down with a bad cold about three weeks ago, which subsequently started giving me other problems. This was the main reason why I could not take part in the Kirtan Mela this year in Mayapura. I missed three of the four days I was scheduled to lead kirtans.

Unfortunately the problem is not going away and has started to get worse. Late this morning I discovered that my voice was gone. I've had laryngitis before, but this time practically nothing comes out when I attempt to speak. With Madana-mohana's encouragement, after he heard me struggling to talk, I decided to go to an ENT specialist.

So far the diagnosis is acute pharyngolaryngitis, with underlying causes of allergic rhinitis and bronchial asthma. The specialist I saw today encouraged me to go for a chest X-ray tomorrow to rule out other possible underlying causes.

Besides the medicine I've been prescribed, I've been told that I must give my voice complete rest, which means that for at least the next couple of days, I will not give lectures nor lead any kirtans. In fact, even soft talking is so irritating that I am going to try to avoid talking as much as possible.

My apologies to those who were hoping for more from me from this visit to Kiev. Let's see if things can improve over the next couple of days.

Hare Krsna

Hare Krishna Dear Devotees,

Please accept my humble obeisances. All glories to Srila Prabhupada!

This blog is intended to make you aware of the various ways of sending letters and reports to H.H. Niranjana Swami.
Most of you are already aware of the recent launch of the online reporting system. All of the disciples are encouraged to gradually move to this system to send their letters and reports to HH Niranjana Swami.
However we understand that not everyone may be able to use this system right away, as there are devotees who:

1. Are accustomed to the old ways and it might take some time for them to completely switch over to this system.
2. Might not be comfortable using the online system for reasons like not having Internet facilities or not having enough exposure of working on the internet applications.
3. Aren’t disciples of HH Niranjana Swami and may want to send the reports/letters to Him.

Therefore we are listing out all the possible ways you can send your reports/letters to HH Niranjana Swami:

1. Using the online reporting system available on the website.
2. The Disciple Database.
3. Through the medium of correspondence secretaries

As for the third option, we would like you to note that in case you write a letter or report about yourself, please send it to Amsumati dd  (amsumati@gmail.com) or Vrndavanesvari dd (vrnda.nrs@gmail.com). However, if you are writing a letter or a report about some of the disciples of HH Niranjana Swami (e.g. counsellor sending reports about counselees), then please send those to Avadatta dd (avadatta16108@gmail.com). If somehow the letters get addressed to the wrong recipient, please do not worry. We will ensure that your letter or report reaches HH Niranjana Swami.

Many disciples have already updated their disciple profile on the website. However, those of you who haven’t, are encouraged to do so. The detailed instructions are available on the following page:
http://www.niranjanaswami.net/en/blog-entry/18751

HH Niranjana Swami is eager to receive reports from devotees. Hence devotees are encouraged to write reports once or twice a year but if something significant happens in their life, they can write more often.

Your servant
Vrndavanesvari dd

data.title: Giriraja's Service to Krishna
data.blurb: The following is a partially edited transcription of a talk given about Giriraja's service to Krsna on June 27, 2009, in New Vraja Dhama, on the occasion of New Vraja Dhama's First Annual Vrndavana Parikrama. The talk was given on "Govardhana Hill" in New Vraja Dhama.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
The following is a partially edited transcription of a talk given about Giriraja's service to Krsna on June 27, 2009, in New Vraja Dhama, on the occasion of New Vraja Dhama's First Annual Vrndavana Parikrama. The talk was given on "Govardhana Hill" in New Vraja Dhama.


So I have been requested to speak about learning devotion from Giriraja. If we want to learn about and understand devotional service, then we must obtain the mercy of a devotee of the Lord. Otherwise devotional service will always remain a great mystery. So even the gopis who are the greatest devotees of the Lord are thinking that "If we want to obtain the fulfillment of our desires, then we should worship the devotee." So the gopis are thinking this way and they are the topmost devotees.

We've learned from Brhad Bhagavatamrita that they are the greatest receptacles of Krsna's mercy. But still the gopis are thinking "We have this desire that we want fulfilled. We want to be able to meet Krsna and in order to be able to meet Krsna we must serve a devotee of Krsna."

So who did the gopis proclaim as the best devotee of Krsna? They proclaimed Giriraja as the best devotee. In Srimad Bhagavatam they have said, "Of all the devotees, this Govardhana Hill is the best! O my friends, this hill supplies Krsna and Balarama, along with Their calves, cows and cowherd friends, with all kinds of necessities -- water for drinking, very soft grass, caves, fruits, flowers and vegetables. In this way the hill offers respects to the Lord. Being touched by the lotus feet of Krsna and Balarama, Govardhana Hill appears very jubilant." (SB 10.21.18)

So this is the meditation the gopis have. They are thinking that Giriraja is the best servant of Krsna. Hari-dasa-varyah. Giriraja is understood both as the greatest servant of Krsna and as Krsna Himself. He assumed this form of Govardhana Hill in order to accept all the offerings of the residents of Vrndavana. In this way, the Lord, after assuming this wonderful form, also simultaneously offered worship to that form.

Sivarama Maharaja was just saying that there is a special characteristic of Govardhana Hill here in New Vraja Dhama. Here we can walk on Him. But Lord Caitanya in Vrndavana, also established the principle that one should not walk on Govardhana Hill. He worshiped Govardhana as nondifferent than Krsna.

For three continuous years, Lord Caitanya carried a Govardhana sila and a gunja mala. He was given both of these from a devotee named Sankarananda Sarasvati. He would oftentimes take the sila and He would put it to His head, embrace it to His heart and He would bathe the sila with His tears. So in this way Lord Caitanya worshiped Giriraja as nondifferent from Krsna.

After worshiping Him in this way, He gave both the sila and gunja mala to Raghunath das Goswami to worship and told him, "Carefully worship this sila by offering water and offering tulasi and by so doing, intense love and greed will awaken within your heart."

So in this way, we understand Giriraja as being nondifferent from the Supreme Lord. But we want to see Giriraja specifically for the sake of developing our internal devotion, we want to see Giriraja also as hari-dasa-varyah, as a servant of the Lord. We should want to follow that principle that if we want the fulfillment of our desires, then we must render service to and we must worship a great devotee of the Lord.

So in this verse it is described how Giriraja is actually rendering service to the Lord by assisting Him in His pastimes. Yesterday we were describing how the Lord's internal potency assists the Lord in the facilitation of His desires to enjoy with His devotees. So in the same way, Giriraja also assists the Lord to facilitate His desire to reciprocate with His devotees. How does He serve the Lord? He serves the Lord by serving His devotees, the cowherd boys, and by serving the cows and calves all of whom are very, very dear to Krsna.

Giriraja is providing so many opulences of Vrndavana for the service of the Supreme Lord. When we think of opulences, we think of something which is very great, very wonderful, and very lavish. But the opulences of Vrndavana are those items which serve the Lord and His devotees in His pastimes such as fresh water, which the Lord can take for drinking, for taking bath, and for washing His mouth after taking prasadam with His cowherd boy friends.

Giriraja also provides very nice soft grasses for Krsna's cows. This grass is a very special aromatic grass that is very, very pleasing to the cows. The cows are very much inclined take only this grass on Govardhana Hill. That is one of the qualities of the grass on Govardhana Hill. It is so aromatic that it attracts Krsna's cows.

Another quality of the grass growing on Govardhana Hill is that it is very nourishing for Krsna's cows. In this way the cows never feel any hunger, disease, or fatigue. It is very soft grass; so soft that even in the summer when there is no rain, the cows never pierce their lips or tongues by chewing on the grass. The result is that the cows who eat this grass provide very aromatic and nourishing milk.

Mother Yasoda was very eager to personally take this milk from the cows who had eaten this special, aromatic grass. So she personally selected this milk in order to prepare some nice yogurt and butter for Krsna. In this way, she hoped that Krsna would stop going to the neighboring houses to steal their butter and yogurt.

Although she was the queen of Vrndavana and she could have arranged for anybody to prepare this butter for Krsna, still she wanted to do it herself because she was thinking, "They won't do it right."

So Govardhana provides this type of grass for Krsna's cows. Giriraja also provides very nice caves for Krsna and His cowherd boy friends to take shelter from the heat of the hot summer sun and to get out of the rain when it is raining. And although we know that the gopis here are seeing Giriraja in terms of the service He renders specifically to Krsna, Balarama, His cows, calves and cowherd boy friends, we know that those same caves also are very wonderful places where Krsna goes to meet with the gopis.

The gopis were speaking this way because they are seeing how Giriraja is a very intimate associate of Krsna. They are very eager to serve Him because they want to get Krsna's intimate association in the same way as Giriraja does..

So Giriraja is also providing very nice fruits wonderful types of drinks, mangoes and pilu juice. Srila Visvanath Cakravarti Thakur also explains in his commentary how Giriraja is providing smooth stones the cowherd boys can use as mirrors, and for sitting places where Krsna and His friends sit down to take their lunch. He also provides jewels to decorate the body. These are the opulences Giriraja is offering as seva, or service to the Supreme Lord.

Visvanath Cakravarti Thakur has given us a very wonderful explanation of how the gopis were thinking about Giriraja. Once, the gopis were saying "We have heard from Gargi (who is the daughter of Gargamuni) that without rendering service to a devotee one cannot get the fulfillment of one's desires. Therefore since Govardhana Hill is the best of all devotees, we should go to that place. Let us take our bath at Manasa Ganga and take darshan of Harideva."

This deity of Harideva manifested because of the intense feelings of separation the gopis had for Him there. Prior to that, the gopis were feeling a very intense separation from Krsna and they were standing at this place by Manasa Ganga, calling out the name, "Harideva, Harideva, Harideva." Due to their intense desire to see Krsna, this deity manifested there and was called Harideva. From that day on the gopis would come there every day and would worship that Deity.

The gopis continued, "Certainly our elders will have no objection to this." As we know, the gopis were always very concerned about what their elders would say if they were found associating with Krsna. But now the gopis were thinking "How can they possibly complain if we simply go there and take darshan of Harideva. But while we are there, we will get the opportunity to see Krsna who will be with His cowherd boys friends on the slopes of Govardhana Hill.

So deciding upon this plan, the gopis glorified Govardhana because He fulfills the desires of Krsna and His companions and hopefully He would then fulfill their desires to meet Krsna. So this is the gopis' meditation. This is how they see Giriraja as the best of all the servants of Krsna because Giriraja facilitates all these pastimes of the Lord.

Giriraja also served the Lord by manifesting Himself as an umbrella in order to protect His Vrndavana devotees who were being inundated by the torrential rains sent by Indra. In this way Giriraja facilitated another wonderful pastime of the Lord, bringing all of the devotees together in one place to be with Krsna. Although ordinarily, the devotees see Krsna differently according to the places they meet, the unique quality of this pastime is that all of the devotees were all with Krsna in one place at the same time.

For instance Mother Yasoda does not know that Krsna was somewhere other than in bed at night. She has her vatsalya prema and always sees everything connected to Krsna's being her young son. When Krsna would be in bed in the morning, Mother Yasoda would see scratches on His body and would think that these scratches were there because Krsna was not careful while He was out playing during the previous day, running into thorns and branches in the forest along with His friends. So in this way her vatsalya prema was never disturbed by thinking that Krsna was someplace else during the night.

So Mother Yasoda would see Krsna at home and she would also see Krsna when He was leaving to go off to the pasturing grounds in the morning. She would want to go with Krsna when He was going off to the pasturing grounds but Krsna wouldn't let her.

Mother Yasoda would make so many different excuses to prevent Krsna from going into the pasturing grounds. As He was leaving with His friends, she would stop Him to give Him something to eat. Then she would walk back towards the house and she would turn to look at Krsna finding another reason to go and to be with her son. Then she would return back to Him and she would adjust His clothing so that it would look proper. After doing that she would have to walk back towards the house, again anticipating Krsna's departure. But since she didn't want Krsna to leave, she would walk back to Him again and would tell all of His friends, "Now protect my son and make sure that you stand on all sides and behind Him so that nothing dangerous happens to Him when He's in the forest and pasturing grounds.

Then she would turn again to return to her home, but then she would find another reason to go to Him. But Krsna finally went and clasped her lotus feet and said, "Mother, please go home. My friends are waiting." And Mother Yasoda would just stand there. It's described in the Brhad Bhagavatamrita how she appeared just like a painted picture or like a cow feeling separation from her calf as Krsna was turning around and walking into the pasturing grounds.

But in this Govardhana lila, when Krsna lifted Govardhana Hill, Giriraja facilitated such a wonderful pastime of arranging all of the devotees to be together in the same place for seven continuous days. So in this way, Giriraja is also facilitating the Lord's pastimes.

So we are worshiping and remembering Giriraja today as a great devotee of Lord Krsna. In this way we should understand that if we ever want to participate in the Lord's pastimes and if we want to be in the association of the Lord, then we must obtain the mercy of a devotee of the Lord. We can never obtain devotional service of the Lord without obtaining the mercy of Krsna's devotees.

So hopefully today we have learned a little about devotion to Lord Krsna by remembering Giriraja in His role as the greatest servant of Lord Krsna. If we worship and serve Giriraja we also can have hope within our hearts that we may obtain the association of Krsna some day in His eternal pastimes.

OK. So we will stop here and let Lokanath Maharaja speak. Hare Krsna.

In this way we should understand that if we ever want to participate in the Lord's pastimes and if we want to be in the association of the Lord, then we must obtain the mercy of a devotee of the Lord. We can never obtain devotional service of the Lord without obtaining the mercy of Krsna's devotees.

So hopefully today we have learned a little about devotion to Lord Krsna by remembering Giriraja in His role as the greatest servant of Lord Krsna. If we worship and serve Giriraja we also can have hope within our hearts that we may obtain the association of Krsna some day in His eternal pastimes.

OK. So we will stop here and let Lokanath Maharaja speak. Hare Krsna.

data.title: Experimental Daily Sadhana Sheet
data.blurb: Not long ago I created a system for a disciple where she can access an online spreadsheet and enter her daily sadhana. Each day, the system then automatically forwards her daily sadhana entries to a place where I can review them.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
Not long ago I created a system for a disciple where she can access an online spreadsheet and enter her daily sadhana. Each day, the system then automatically forwards her daily sadhana entries to a place where I can review them.

There is no correspondence. I simply review her daily entries and she is satisfied by knowing that her daily entries are being reviewed.

As a result, this disciple has found the enthusiasm to not only maintain, but to gradually increase her sadhana. It became a source of enlivenment for her and naturally, for me too.

I wish to conduct an experiment and extend this opportunity to more devotees who have been struggling with their daily sadhana.

For obvious reasons, I cannot open this up to everyone. It would not be possible for me to review everyone's daily entries if this became popular among a lot of disciples.

For now, as an experiment, I am ready to do this for ten more disciples. The criteria will be as follows:

1) Struggling with sadhana (unable to maintain vow of 16 rounds/daily)
2) There must be a strong desire to gradually improve.
3) Must be honest with his/her entries
4) Must make entries every day
5) Must not use the daily sadhana sheet for anything other than reporting daily sadhana

The following information is entered daily:

Date
Time of Rising
Rounds Chanted
Time Spent Reading
Association of other devotees on that day
Time Spent Listening to Lectures
A Short Additional Comment

Although these sheets will be accessed on a special website, (there is no access to a forwarding email address) each sheet will be password protected with its own unique password. Only the author will be allowed to see the contents of his/her own sheet.

To take advantage of this opportunity, you may enter your email address and name into the designated spaces at the bottom of this post.

The first ten devotees to sign up will receive instructions for accessing their assigned sheet and for making their entries. If no instructions are received within a week, it means that you were not among the first ten.

However, those who sign up after the first ten, might still get a chance to take advantage of this facility. If any of the original ten do not make daily entries into his/her sadhana sheet (the absolute minimum will be five out of seven entries a week), or if there is any form of abuse (i.e. using the sadhana sheet for anything other than reporting daily sadhana), access to the sheet will be promptly revoked and the next person on the list will be given his/her sadhana sheet with a new password.

I must repeat, for now this is only an experiment. It may or may not continue, depending upon the outcome. If, at any time, this becomes too troublesome for me, I will have to discontinue.

However, if everything goes smoothly, and if I can see an improvement in sadhana for those who are taking part, or at least an improvement in one's attitude towards sadhana, this will certainly be an impetus for me to allow it to continue and possibly even increase the number of participants in the future.

Hare Krsna

 

 

 

Sign-up for your daily sadhana sheet
