data.title: Carpathian Festival
data.blurb: I thought I should inform those who may be interested to know that my ability to participate in the upcoming Carpathian Festival (from June 11 – 16) still remains unknown.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
I thought I should inform those who may be interested to know that my ability to participate in the upcoming Carpathian Festival (from June 11 – 16) still remains unknown.

I'm in the process of dealing with immigration matters here in Kiev and there are delays which are beyond my control and the control of those who are assisting me.

If my papers should manifest, I must be here in Kiev to process them and it seems that I will also have to turn in my passport. All I can do is wait from one day to the next, hoping that my documents will appear soon.

Unless my documents appear tomorrow, it seems almost certain that I will not be at the beginning of the Carpathian Festival. However, I still remain hopeful that I may be able to attend at least on Saturday and Sunday.

I will update this online notice only if there is something concrete to report. Otherwise devotees will have to assume that I "may" or "may not" be there.

Hare Krsna

data.title: Excerpts from this morning's class by Srila Prabhupada
data.blurb: While exercising this morning I was listening to a lecture Srila Prabhupada gave in London, on July 25, 1973 on the Bhagavad-gita verses 1.32-35.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
While exercising this morning I was listening to a lecture Srila Prabhupada gave in London, on July 25, 1973 on the Bhagavad-gita verses 1.32-35.

The following excerpts from his class caught my attention. After each excerpt, I have given a explanation why I had taken note of the point.

Excerpt:

matulah svasurah pautrah
syalah sambandhinas tatha
etan na hantum icchami
ghnato 'pi madhusudana

"My dear Krsna, Madhusudana." He is not addressing Krsna as "Krsna." He is addressing Him, "Madhusudana." He is reminding Him that "You also killed, but You kill Your enemies, Madhu." Madhu was a demon. Madhu-kaitabha-bhare hari-murare. Madhu-kaitabha-bhare. So, "You are Madhusudana. You are the killer of Madhu demon, who was Your enemy. You are not Nanda-sudana or Yasoda-sudana." That is reminding Him, little critically, that "You are Yourself Madhusudana. You kill only Your enemies. Why You are inducing me to kill my kinsmen?" This is the criticism. So etan na hantum icchami. So "You may induce me, but I am not going to kill them." Etan na hantum. Hantum, "To kill, I am not willing." Then the question may be that "It is fight. If you do not kill, if you stand still, then they will kill you. Because it is fight. Then what you will do?" "Yes, I agree." Ghnato 'pi. "If they kill me, I agree. Still, I will not kill them." Ghnato 'pi. "Even they kill me, I will not fight, I will not kill them. But if they kill me, that is also agreed; still, I will not kill." Just see how much determination. This is called family attraction.

Explanation:

This is one of the many points Srila Prabhupada was using in the lecture to elaborate on Arjuna's attachment to family and why that made it impossible for Arjuna to fight. Srila Prabhupada introduced Arjuna's arguments to Krsna for resisting his duties in a way I had never heard them before. Whenever I think of the above quoted verse, I usually think that Arjuna addressed Krsna as "Madhusudana" because he was asking Krsna to destroy his own demon of doubts. But this argument is very interesting. He's saying, "You are Madhusudana. You kill only Your enemies. So why, therefore, are You inducing me to kill my kinsmen?", and then Prabhupada even suggests that Arjuna was being a little critical by suggesting this to Him. Of course, it is pastime, and Arjuna is never critical of Krsna. But it does illustrate the dangers of attachment and how it can run so deep that we will find any argument possible against the authority of the Lord, even to the point of finding some fault in Him.

Excerpt:

[…]according to Vedic system, there are ten kinds of samskara, reformatory method. This upanayana-samskara, this is also one of the samskara, sacred thread. Upanayana. Upa means near, and nayana means bringing. When the spiritual master brings nearer to spiritual consciousness, a person is given the upanayana, or the sacred thread. The sacred thread is the indication that "This man is now under the control of the spiritual master for advancing in Krsna consciousness." This thread ceremony. This is called upanayana. Similarly, there is reformatory method, marriage, ten kinds of reformatory... The first beginning is garbhadhana. So these things are impossible to introduce now in this Kali-yuga. Therefore the only reformatory method is: harer nama harer nama harer namaiva kevalam, kalau nasty eva nasty eva nasty eva gatir anyatha [Cc. Adi 17.21]. In this age of Kali, people are so fallen, so degraded, that it is not possible to introduce systematically the whole Vedic principle; it is not possible. That is not possible. It is Caitanya Mahaprabhu's grace, mercy, that He has given us mercifully, vairagya-vidya-nija-bhakti [Cc. Madhya 6.254], just to teach very short-cut method. What is that? Chant Hare Krsna. Simple. Simple. Ceto-darpana-marjanam bhava-maha-davagni [Cc. Antya 20.12].

Explanation:

The particular point which caught my attention in the above excerpt was Srila Prabhupada's indication that it is not possible to systematically introduce the whole Vedic principle in this age. He was not suggesting that upanayana samskara and garbhadhana samskara should not be performed. His comment was specifically about the "whole Vedic principle", which included the dasa-vidha-samskara (the ten Vedic household rituals for purification, performed one by one from the time of conception until death.) In fact, in a room conversation which took place just one week before this lecture I was listening to today, Srila Prabhupada had this to say:

Paramahamsa: Srila Prabhupada, I wanted to ask you that in your lectures you continually speak of the ten samskaras that children should have.
Prabhupada: Well, that is not possible.
Paramahamsa: Oh.
Prabhupada: That is not possible. It is very difficult. One samskara, that initiation samskara, and marriage samskara-two, three samskaras, can be done, not the ten. It is not possible. Now the circumstances will not allow. It is very difficult.

Srila Prabhupada is certainly not decrying the "whole Vedic principle". Certainly we must adopt Vedic principles within all the four asramas. But emphasis should always remain fixed on the "short-cut method", especially in this age. Without emphasis on chanting the pure holy name, without any offenses, there is no hope for achieving perfection in this age simply by following the "whole Vedic principle." And Srila Prabhupada's mission was to teach Lord Caitanya's method which He, Himself, came to teach.

vairagya-vidya-nija-bhakti-yoga-
siksartham ekah purusah puranah
sri-krsna-caitanya-sarira-dhari
krpambudhir yas tam aham prapadye

TRANSLATION
"Let me take shelter of the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Sri Krsna, who has descended in the form of Lord Caitanya Mahaprabhu to teach us real knowledge, His devotional service and detachment from whatever does not foster Krsna consciousness. He has descended because He is an ocean of transcendental mercy. Let me surrender unto His lotus feet.

In other words, the "whole Vedic principle" which is meant to guide the living being right from the time of his birth until the time of his death, by following a series of purificatory methods, can be achieved by the pure chanting of Krsna's holy names.

iti sodasakam namnam
kali-kalmasa-nasanam
natah parataropayah
sarva-vedesu drsyate

"After searching through all the Vedic literature, one cannot find a method of religion more sublime for this age than the chanting of Hare Krsna."

Hare Krsna

Of course, it is pastime, and Arjuna is never critical of Krsna. But it does illustrate the dangers of attachment and how it can run so deep that we will find any argument possible against the authority of the Lord, even to the point of finding some fault in Him.

Excerpt:

[…]according to Vedic system, there are ten kinds of samskara, reformatory method. This upanayana-samskara, this is also one of the samskara, sacred thread. Upanayana. Upa means near, and nayana means bringing. When the spiritual master brings nearer to spiritual consciousness, a person is given the upanayana, or the sacred thread. The sacred thread is the indication that "This man is now under the control of the spiritual master for advancing in Krsna consciousness." This thread ceremony. This is called upanayana. Similarly, there is reformatory method, marriage, ten kinds of reformatory... The first beginning is garbhadhana. So these things are impossible to introduce now in this Kali-yuga. Therefore the only reformatory method is: harer nama harer nama harer namaiva kevalam, kalau nasty eva nasty eva nasty eva gatir anyatha [Cc. Adi 17.21]. In this age of Kali, people are so fallen, so degraded, that it is not possible to introduce systematically the whole Vedic principle; it is not possible. That is not possible. It is Caitanya Mahaprabhu's grace, mercy, that He has given us mercifully, vairagya-vidya-nija-bhakti [Cc. Madhya 6.254], just to teach very short-cut method. What is that? Chant Hare Krsna. Simple. Simple. Ceto-darpana-marjanam bhava-maha-davagni [Cc. Antya 20.12].

Explanation:

The particular point which caught my attention in the above excerpt was Srila Prabhupada's indication that it is not possible to systematically introduce the whole Vedic principle in this age. He was not suggesting that upanayana samskara and garbhadhana samskara should not be performed. His comment was specifically about the "whole Vedic principle", which included the dasa-vidha-samskara (the ten Vedic household rituals for purification, performed one by one from the time of conception until death.) In fact, in a room conversation which took place just one week before this lecture I was listening to today, Srila Prabhupada had this to say:

Paramahamsa: Srila Prabhupada, I wanted to ask you that in your lectures you continually speak of the ten samskaras that children should have.
Prabhupada: Well, that is not possible.
Paramahamsa: Oh.
Prabhupada: That is not possible. It is very difficult. One samskara, that initiation samskara, and marriage samskara-two, three samskaras, can be done, not the ten. It is not possible. Now the circumstances will not allow. It is very difficult.

Srila Prabhupada is certainly not decrying the "whole Vedic principle". Certainly we must adopt Vedic principles within all the four asramas. But emphasis should always remain fixed on the "short-cut method", especially in this age. Without emphasis on chanting the pure holy name, without any offenses, there is no hope for achieving perfection in this age simply by following the "whole Vedic principle." And Srila Prabhupada's mission was to teach Lord Caitanya's method which He, Himself, came to teach.

vairagya-vidya-nija-bhakti-yoga-
siksartham ekah purusah puranah
sri-krsna-caitanya-sarira-dhari
krpambudhir yas tam aham prapadye

TRANSLATION
"Let me take shelter of the Supreme Personality of Godhead, Sri Krsna, who has descended in the form of Lord Caitanya Mahaprabhu to teach us real knowledge, His devotional service and detachment from whatever does not foster Krsna consciousness. He has descended because He is an ocean of transcendental mercy. Let me surrender unto His lotus feet.

In other words, the "whole Vedic principle" which is meant to guide the living being right from the time of his birth until the time of his death, by following a series of purificatory methods, can be achieved by the pure chanting of Krsna's holy names.

iti sodasakam namnam
kali-kalmasa-nasanam
natah parataropayah
sarva-vedesu drsyate

"After searching through all the Vedic literature, one cannot find a method of religion more sublime for this age than the chanting of Hare Krsna."

Hare Krsna

data.title: Initiations in Magdalinivka on July 3rd
data.blurb: Since it was not clear for a long time whether there would be a Bhakti Sangama Festival this year or not (although it is clear now that it will take place this year in late August), I agreed to give initiations in Magdalinivka on the day after Vyasa Puja (July 3rd, morning).
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
Since it was not clear for a long time whether there would be a Bhakti Sangama Festival this year or not (although it is clear now that it will take place this year in late August), I agreed to give initiations in Magdalinivka on the day after Vyasa Puja (July 3rd, morning).

In this connection, I have a few requests I would like to present here in my blog.

1) Devotees being recommended for either first or second initiation this year should plan to take initiation in Magdalinivka and not at the Bhakti Sangama Festival. If any candidate for initiation has a valid reason for not being able to attend the initiations in Magdalinivka and can only come to the Bhakti Sangama Festival, they should notify Madana-mohana dasa of this by email or in writing, prior to July 1, 2014. If there are no notifications of this, I will assume that there will be no recommendations for initiation given to me at the Bhakti Sangama Festival and will therefore not give any initiations at the Bhakti Sangama Festival this year.

2) Please submit your recommendation for initiation to Madana-mohana dasa, delivered either by hand or by email, no later than June 27, 2014. Please be sure to provide a telephone number of the person giving the recommendation along with the recommendation in case something is not clear in the recommendation.

3) Please make sure that the candidate's counselor has submitted his/her latest counseler report about each candidate being recommended into the online database of reports. If it is not clear to the counselor where his/her report should be sent, he/she can get a detailed explanation from either Vrndavanesvari devi dasi (vrnda.nrs@gmail.com) or Tota Gopinath dasa (ttgopi@gmail.com).

4) Please review the initiation standards presented below (as given to me today from the Ukrainian National Council) and be sure that all requirements have been fulfilled.

5) Regarding the standards given below, please remember that in addition to them, it is my personal wish that aspiring disciples must have chanted sixteen rounds a day, and must have followed the regulative principles for four years before I can accept a recommendation for initiation from them. Anyone living in an ISKCON temple asrama for three continuous years, who has chanted sixteen rounds and followed the regulative principles for three continuous years, and who has fulfilled all the requirements presented below, can also submit a valid recommendation for initiation and it will be accepted.

Hare Krsna

Below are the initiation standards: (They can also be downloaded at the link provided below this blog)

Требования на пранама мантру
Кандидат должен:

1. Повторять ежедневно 16 кругов Харе Кришна Маха-мантры на четках и строго следовать четырем регулирующим принципам без срывов, в течении по меньшей мере 6 месяцев.
2. Успешно сдать руководству местного храма тест из 16 вопросов (редакция от 2013 года, включающая понимание линий руководства ИСККОН и роли Шрилы Прабхупады).

Требования на первое посвящение
Кандидат должен:

1. Повторять ежедневно 16 кругов Харе Кришна Маха-мантры на четках и строго следовать четырем регулирующим принципам без срывов в течении по меньшей мере последних двух лет после получения пранама мантры.
2. Успешно сдать тест на первое посвящение.
3. Следовать ежедневной садхане (для живущих в храме – ранний подъем, утренняя служба; для живущих дома – ежедневная духовная программа, включающая поклонение, воспевание и т.д. ) и читать книги Шрилы Прабхупады не менее часа в день.
4. В течении последних двух лет регулярно посещать храмовые программы (для живущих в храме – ежедневно, для проживающих дома – в зависимости от конкретной ситуации, но не реже одной программы в неделю).
5. В течении последних двух лет регулярно заниматься в рамках организационной структуры ИСККОН практическим служением.
6. При наличии в общине системы наставников, кандидат должен принять наставника (инициированный преданный (-ая) своего пола, одобренный (-ая) руководством храма) и регулярно посещать проводимые им программы.
7. Желательно занимать устойчивое положение в своем ашраме.

Для мужчин: желательно, чтобы кандидат был либо грихастхой, официально состоящим в браке (гражданский брак расценивается как нарушение принципов и является дисквалификацией для получения посвящения), либо брахмачари, живущем в официально признанном ашраме брахмачари ИСККОН. (Данное пожелание не относится к кандидатам старше 55 лет).

Пожелания для женщин: незамужние женщины, живущие дома, могут быть рекомендованы при условии, что они соответствуют всем остальным требованиям.
Если кандидат не занимает  устойчивого положения в ашраме, испытательный срок должен быть продлен.

8. Успешно сдать экзамены по курсу «Программа бхакт».
9. Для рекомендации необходимо, чтобы кандидата, помимо его наставника хорошо знали и рекомендовали два других наставника.  


Требования на второе посвящение

Для получения второго посвящения, к кандидату предъявляются все требования, необходимые для получения первого посвящения, плюс следующие:

1. Повторять ежедневно 16 кругов Харе Кришна Маха-мантры на четках и строго следовать четырем регулирующим принципам без срывов в течении по меньшей мере последних трех лет после первого посвящения.
2. Успешно сдать тест на второе посвящение.
3. Строго следовать садхане, правилам вайшнавского этикета и соответствовать качествам брахманов, описываемых в Бхагавад Гите (18.42) – чистота, правдивость и проч.
4. Быть регулярно занятым в одном из видов брахманического служения: поклонении Божествам, прямой проповедью, либо, поведение, служение и жизнь кандидата должны быть настолько примерными, что образцовое исполнение им своих обязанностей является проповедью для окружающих.
5. Пройти обучение по курсу Бхакти-шастры и успешно сдать официальный экзамен, либо, по меньшей мере, успешно проходить обучение по данному курсу. (Это требование не является обязательным для кандидатов старше 50 лет)
• Кандидат может получить второе посвящение, даже не отвечая требованиям, предъявляемым пунктами 4 и 5, при условии, что со времени получения им первого посвящения прошло больше 10 лет.


Дополнительные правила

Приведенные выше минимальные требования для получения рекомендаций на пранама-мантру, первое и второе посвящения не являются гарантией их получения, поскольку некоторые духовные учителя предъявляют свои, более строгие требования.

Если кандидат на получение первого и второго посвящения служил в данном храме меньше времени, указанного как условие для рекомендации, необходима также рекомендация от руководства предыдущего храма, в котором кандидат занимался служением. Если же руководство этого храма не считает возможным дать рекомендацию, кандидату следует подождать в течении указанных сроков, продолжая заниматься служением в нынешнем храме.

data.blurb:
Дорогие преданные!

Пожалуйста, примите мои поклоны. Слава Шриле Прабхупаде.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
Дорогие преданные!

Пожалуйста, примите мои поклоны. Слава Шриле Прабхупаде.

С радостью сообщаю, что в этом году на Вьяса-пудже в Магдалиновке, помимо остальных книг, будет распространяться новая книга писем Гуру Махараджа. В нее вошли письма с 2005 по 2011 гг. В книге 288 страниц, твердая обложка и куча приложений.

Цена за книгу 3.5 доллара. Хочу напомнить, что книги Гуру Махараджа распространяются за минимальную стоимость, призванную покрыть расходы на печать.

Сейчас, в связи с политической обстановкой на Украине, многие преданные, вероятно, не смогут приехать. Так что если кто-то поедет на Вьяса-пуджу, пожалуйста, позаботьтесь о своих духовных братьях и сестрах и привезите им книги.

Также вскоре после Вьяса-пуджи эту и другие книги можно будет заказать через книгу-почтой на Украине и в России (из России возможна отправка в другие страны снг и дальше).

Книга-почтой на Украине http://niranjanaswami.com/uaorder/
Книга-почтой в России http://niranjanaswami.com/ruorder/

Ваша слуга,
Югала Пирити дд

My godbrother, Guru Gauranga Prabhu, requested me to take part in the event he helped organize in Switzerland last week, commemorating Srila Prabhupada's visit to Switzerland on May 29th, 1974, exactly forty years prior to the first day of the festival.

Although I was never involved in the Swiss Yatra, he very much wanted me to be there since we are close friends and he had not been to the Zurich temple (the temple that he personally purchased and opened himself) for almost twenty-five years. I therefore wanted to be there, for no other reason than to be there with him, knowing that it could be a very overwhelming visit for him.

The festival began outside Geneva at a rented facility in the foothills of the Alps. About seventy devotees assembled for the opening festivities on May 29th, many of them older devotees who either joined in the 1970's or early 1980's.

Unfortunately, when applying for harinama permits in Geneva, the authorities tried to impose a long list of strict rules for the harinama. Guru Gauranga Prabhu had to negotiate with them on almost every point. An agreement was finally reached which limited the harinama to fifteen people. There also had to be four people dressed with flourescent vests assigned for security and for keeping the devotees in line. If I were to write the list of restrictions, it would take up another full page. But, somehow, by Krsna's grace, we managed to chant the holy names in downtown Geneva and along the banks of Lake Geneva for over three hours (see video on the bottom of the home page), and passed through the places where devotees used to regularly chant back in the 1970's.

While harinama was going on in Geneva, the rest of the devotees heard many stories about the early days in Switzerland from some of the early pioneers of the Swiss yatra, such as Rohini Suta Prabhu, Prthu Prabhu, and Jaya Gurudeva Prabhu.

The harinama party returned by 6:00 PM and honored some very wonderful prasadam the local devotees prepared, three times a day, for all of the attendees. The rest of the evening was spent hearing from all who assembled as they told us their names, their connection with the Swiss yatra, and a little bit about themselves. It was a very intimate event which ended by 10:00 PM.

On the following day, after a full morning program, Guru Gauranga Prabhu took at least forty of us on pilgrimage to the places Srila Prabhupada visited during his nine-day visit in 1974, including the park where he took his daily walks, the old temple which Srila Prabhupada stayed in, and the larger temple they acquired some years later (see photos).

Our first stop was the first temple. We drove there in six separate vehicles, one behind the other, not really knowing what we would do once we got there other than to look at the front of the building. In the car on our way to the pilgrimage site, Guru Gauranga Prabhu expressed a very strong desire to go inside, though he admitted that he could not imagine what kind of reaction the people living there would have when asked if the devotees could be allowed in. I had to confess, that I had my doubts too. Still he expressed determination to ask and resigned himself to leaving the rest up to Krsna.

The small building was on a very small and quiet residential street. Behind the building was a large housing development which was built since the time the devotees had lived there. Across the street was a large school which was also seemed newly constructed. But somehow, on that particular street, all the old buildings were still standing.

While we all stood out front, examining the building, Guru Gauranga Prabhu decided to knock on the door to see if anyone was home. I was thinking that even if the person was home, they might be a little fearful about answering the door. It's not every day that forty to fifty people stand outside the front of one's home, examining the building and looking for opportunities to see what's inside. To a casual observer, it almost looked as if it was a protest of sorts and we were getting ready to storm the building.

After a short exchange with the owner, she very warmly welcomed anyone who wanted to come inside and walk around to their heart's content. None of us could really believe how hospitable this woman was towards the devotees. One by one, they all walked through the house while Guru Gauranga Prabhu reminisced about Prabhupada's visit, pointing out which room he stayed in, which room he slept in, and which room he spoke in. The devotees eagerly listened while touring the building.

We then decided to visit the backyard where Srila Prabhupada conducted initiations during his visit. Again, the woman invited all of us to sit there while Guru Gauranga Prabhu led a short and emotional kirtan, after which he shared a few short stories about the initiations that transpired there forty years prior. During this time, one godbrother of mine was speaking casually to the woman who lived there with her children, and almost apologetically, said to her, "We must look a little bit strange to you, don't we", to which she replied, "Maybe… but you are all so very nice!" She had been very much won over by the devotees' dealings with her.

Our pilgrimage then continued to the other places where the devotees formerly served as we all listened attentively to stories told about the "early days" in Geneva. Unfortunately there is currently no temple in Geneva, but devotees regularly visit for local nama hatta programs.

We then returned to the festival site for another evening of remembrances and stories from the early pioneers who were instrumental for the establishment and growth of the Swiss yatra.

The following morning after the morning program, Guru Gauranga Prabhu, one other godbrother and myself drove a short distance across the border into France to look for the small temple a few devotees stayed in while they gradually established their presence in Geneva. Unfortunately it was no longer there, but Guru Gauranga said he could not leave Geneva without at least trying to see if it was still there.

We then returned to Zurich, honored lunch prasadam and went out on harinama. This time there was at least one hundred enthusiastic devotees, chanting and dancing in a beautiful park along the lake, filled with hundreds of local people and tourists, many of whom seemed to greatly appreciate the devotees' presence (see photos). After two hours of chanting and dancing, we then returned to the temple where more of the same (remembrances) continued well into the evening.

On Sunday, Srimad Bhagavatam class in the morning was given by Rohini Suta Prabhu. Festivities were then held throughout the rest of the day. Gradually, the temple also filled up with the usual Sunday Feast guests, filling the whole building as well as the garden out front, with a very festive atmosphere. Bhajans were led in the afternoon by Locanananda Prabhu, I was then asked to give the Sunday lecture, and after the lecture one of the most incredible feasts I have seen for many years was served out to the hundreds of guests who were in attendance. I couldn't resist tasting at least some of the preparations.

In the evening, Locanananda Prabhu and I led bhajans, and the festival came to a close. I felt overwhelmed by the association I was able to experience, nonstop, for the five days I was in Switzerland. Not only did I get the opportunity to meet many of the current devotees of the Swiss yatra, but I was also able to spend some intimate time with several godbrothers who, other than Guru Gauranga Prabhu, I had not seen for a very long time. Needless to say, for me, it was this association which made my visit to Switzerland a very memorable event.

Hare Krsna

Харе Кришна.

Ниже приводится информация для тех из вас, кто планирует принять участие в фестивале Вьяса-пуджи с 1 по 3 июля под Днепропетровском.

*******************************************************************************************************************************

 

Харе Кришна!
Дорогие преданные, пожалуйста, примите наши поклоны.
Слава Шриле Прабхупаде!
Пожалуйста, поделитесь этой информацией с другими учениками Е.С. Ниранджана Свами и повесьте этот текст на досках объявлений в храмах.
О ВЬЯСА-ПУДЖЕ Е.С. НИРАНДЖАНА СВАМИ
Как мы уже сообщали, Вьяса-Пуджа Е.С. Ниранджана Свами состоится 1-3 июля в Вайшнавском образовательном центре «Новый Маяпур» в Магдалиновском районе,  Днепропетровской области. 1 июля преданных будут встречать на вокзале в Днепропетровске и отвозить на автобусах на место проведения Вьяса Пуджи.

О РАСПИСАНИИ
В этом году по просьбе Махараджа расписание Вьяса-пуджи будет построено таким образом, что основная лекция будет в первый день 1 июля в 17-18 часов. На второй день будет собственно Вьяса Пуджа, и в этот день Махарадж не планирует много говорить, и в третий день будет инициация.

О НАСТРОЕНИИ
В этом году Вьяса Пуджа по целому ряду причин будет проходить в несколько непривычных условиях, и об этом хочется сказать несколько слов. Мы уже привыкли к определенным материальным стандартам проведения Вьяса-Пуджи духовного учителя. Иногда условия чуть лучше, иногда чуть хуже, но в целом зачастую многие из нас представляют себе  Вьяса-Пуджу, как некий фестиваль, куда мы приезжаем, как гости, где все устроено невидимыми силами, и мы одержимы одним желанием: комфортно поселиться, желательно поближе к залу, и успеть на лекцию, раздачу торта и прасад. Здесь будет немного другая история. Похоже Кришна устроил эту ситуацию таким образом, чтобы каждый из нас смог проявить свои лучшие вайшнавские качества.
В этом году каждый из нас сможет вместо того, чтобы пытаться любой ценой комфортно поселиться, постараться уступить лучшее место тем, кто в этом больше нуждается; вместо того, чтобы оценивать, насколько комфортным было пребывание на Вьяса-Пудже, активно включиться в служение, взять на себя ответственность и сделать что-то важное для преданных; вместо того, чтобы «купить билет на Вьяса-Пуджу», использовать всю свою творческую энергию для того, чтобы придумать, как послужить Духовному Учителю и преданным. Ведь наибольшую радость Гуру доставляет видеть, как его ученики сотрудничают в служении Кришне.

О СЛУЖЕНИИ
Список преданных, которые смогут квалифицированно занять всех желающих в служении:
Приготовление прасада    Доял Кришна д +380934656579
Раздача прасада Мадхава Кришна д +380677070179
Программа Вьяса Пуджи Гаура Пурнима д +380676318989 gaurapurnima.nrs@gmail.com

Организация ягьи  бх. Михаил   +380 (95) 282 12 42  kolombo78@gmail.com

Регистрация   Адикави д +380982837766  adikavidas.nrs@gmail.com

Хозяйственно-бытовой департамент Севананда д +380937473296

Уборка территории Судхира д +38 063 149 73 69  suhira.nrs@gmail.com

108 блюд Ситала дд +38067 939 28 96  sitala.nrs@gmail.com

Детская программа Нирмала Према дд  +380949285582

Гирлянды Ишвари дд  (095)2790654

Украшение зала: бх-н Виктория: +38 066 197 78 61;  +38 063109 39 39

Торт: Рактака д +380982189271 raktaka@mail.ru
Охрана: Прана Валлабха д: +38066 974 14 42 yuriy.shtefan@mail.ru
Оргвопросы: Према Раса д: +38 067 630 10 01 yatra@ukr.net

О РАЗМЕЩЕНИИ
Условия жизни на Базе «Новый Маяпур» достаточно просты и кому-то могут даже показаться аскетичными:
• Корпуса с девятиместными номерами с горячей водой и санузлом на этаже. Туда мы планируем поселить женщин.
• Несколько 4-5 местных номеров с удобствами на этаже, куда можно поселить женщин с детьми.
• Дхармашала с кроватями на 40 человек (туалет и душ с горячей водой на территории) для мужчин.
• Дхармашала на полу (приезжать со своими карематами и спальниками) 40 чел для мужчин (душ и туалет на территории).
• Палаточный городок на берегу чистой прекрасной реки (приезжать со своими палатками).
• Кроме того, на базе «Новый Маяпур» есть небольшая гостиница, где удобства в номере. Там будет жить Е.С. Ниранджана Свами и почетные гости. Несколько номеров, которые останутся мы хотели бы отдать пожилым людям, которые по состоянию здоровья не могут жить в более простых условиях.
• Для тех, кто по разным причинам не сможет жить на базе Новый Маяпур, будут забронированы гостиницы в 40-70 км от места проведения Вьяса Пуджи, куда их будут доставлять автобусами.
Из-за большого количества новшеств, мы не знаем, сколько преданных приедет на Вьяса-Пуджу в этом году. Это затрудняет процесс подготовки. Поэтому мы смиренно просим всех, кто собирается приехать, сообщить об этом и сказать, в какой из категорий жилья вы сможете жить.
По этим вопросам, связывайтесь, пожалуйста, с Аравиндой пр в Киеве: +380 (98) 964 89 55 aravinda-das@yandex.ru
Если вы хотите забронировать гостиницу в 40-70 км от места проведения Вьяса-Пуджи, свяжитесь, пожалуйста, с Нандой Махараджем пр: +380 (67) 629 21 21 nanda@bk.ru

О ПОЖЕРТВОВАНИЯХ
Следуя наставлениям Гуру Махараджа о том, что вайшнавские фестивали должны организовываться только на основе добровольных пожертвований, в этом году мы решили попробовать и не устанавливать фиксированную плату не только на организацию праздника, но и за жилье. Подсчитав затраты на прасад, транспорт, украшения, подношения Махараджу, а так же затраты на то, чтобы улучшить условия жизни в «Новом Маяпуре» (горячая вода и др), мы можем сказать, что пребывание одного человека на Вьяса-Пудже будет обходиться приблизительно в 45-50 $ (540-600 грн, 1400-1600 руб.). Разумеется, мы никого не ограничиваем и не устанавливаем строгих рамок. Каждый может пожертвовать столько, сколько подсказывает ему сердце.

О ГРУСТНОМ
К сожалению, из-за политической ситуации у мужчин в возрасте до 60 лет из России могут быть проблемы при пересечении границы. Насколько нам известно, женщин, как правило, пускают, но молодых мужчин могут не впустить в Украину.
С уважением ваши слуги из оргкомитета Вьяса-Пуджи

• Несколько 4-5 местных номеров с удобствами на этаже, куда можно поселить женщин с детьми.
• Дхармашала с кроватями на 40 человек (туалет и душ с горячей водой на территории) для мужчин.
• Дхармашала на полу (приезжать со своими карематами и спальниками) 40 чел для мужчин (душ и туалет на территории).
• Палаточный городок на берегу чистой прекрасной реки (приезжать со своими палатками).
• Кроме того, на базе «Новый Маяпур» есть небольшая гостиница, где удобства в номере. Там будет жить Е.С. Ниранджана Свами и почетные гости. Несколько номеров, которые останутся мы хотели бы отдать пожилым людям, которые по состоянию здоровья не могут жить в более простых условиях.
• Для тех, кто по разным причинам не сможет жить на базе Новый Маяпур, будут забронированы гостиницы в 40-70 км от места проведения Вьяса Пуджи, куда их будут доставлять автобусами.
Из-за большого количества новшеств, мы не знаем, сколько преданных приедет на Вьяса-Пуджу в этом году. Это затрудняет процесс подготовки. Поэтому мы смиренно просим всех, кто собирается приехать, сообщить об этом и сказать, в какой из категорий жилья вы сможете жить.
По этим вопросам, связывайтесь, пожалуйста, с Аравиндой пр в Киеве: +380 (98) 964 89 55 aravinda-das@yandex.ru
Если вы хотите забронировать гостиницу в 40-70 км от места проведения Вьяса-Пуджи, свяжитесь, пожалуйста, с Нандой Махараджем пр: +380 (67) 629 21 21 nanda@bk.ru

О ПОЖЕРТВОВАНИЯХ
Следуя наставлениям Гуру Махараджа о том, что вайшнавские фестивали должны организовываться только на основе добровольных пожертвований, в этом году мы решили попробовать и не устанавливать фиксированную плату не только на организацию праздника, но и за жилье. Подсчитав затраты на прасад, транспорт, украшения, подношения Махараджу, а так же затраты на то, чтобы улучшить условия жизни в «Новом Маяпуре» (горячая вода и др), мы можем сказать, что пребывание одного человека на Вьяса-Пудже будет обходиться приблизительно в 45-50 $ (540-600 грн, 1400-1600 руб.). Разумеется, мы никого не ограничиваем и не устанавливаем строгих рамок. Каждый может пожертвовать столько, сколько подсказывает ему сердце.

О ГРУСТНОМ
К сожалению, из-за политической ситуации у мужчин в возрасте до 60 лет из России могут быть проблемы при пересечении границы. Насколько нам известно, женщин, как правило, пускают, но молодых мужчин могут не впустить в Украину.
С уважением ваши слуги из оргкомитета Вьяса-Пуджи

data.title: Notice about upcoming visit to Kiev
data.blurb:
To the devotees in Ukraine:

Please note that although I am scheduled to arrive in Kiev on Monday, June 2nd, the earliest I would do any program in Kiev would be some time on the weekend. In other words, I will not take part in programs of any kind earlier than Saturday, June 7th.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
To the devotees in Ukraine:

Please note that although I am scheduled to arrive in Kiev on Monday, June 2nd, the earliest I would do any program in Kiev would be some time on the weekend. In other words, I will not take part in programs of any kind earlier than Saturday, June 7th.

Given the amount of work I have to take care of while I'm in Kiev, at this time I cannot even commit to do any program on the weekend. In other words, I may or may not do a program on Saturday, June 7th and/or Sunday, June 8th.

If I find time to do a program on the weekend, devotees will be notified by the usual method which the Kiev temple uses to notify devotees of programs.

Additionally, I will not accept any requests for meetings before Monday, June 9th.

Thank you for your understanding.

Hare Krsna

I am currently in transit in Munich, having just flown from Bologna on my way to Zurich. I just spent five days with my godbrother, Trai Prabhu, in Bologna. During that time, I was given the opportunity to spend intimate time with many of the people that Trai Prabhu and his wife have been, inspiring, helping and engaging in the activities of the Bologna preaching center.

Many years ago I decided that I would try my best to visit Trai Prabhu every year in order to get his association as well as to help him in any way possible with his preaching center in Bologna. Although Trai Prabhu had been steadily distributing Srila Prabhupada's books for the past forty years, and most of that time in Italy, he felt a strong desire to do something more for Srila Prabhupada.

Therefore, several years ago, Trai Prabhu decided to move from his former residence in Italy to pioneer a preaching center with his wife, Krsnaloka devi dasi. There was a very small group of devotees in Bologna but there was really no outreach for the people living there. So they rented a small room near the center of the city, lived there, and just started conducting programs there, doing harinamas, and contacting as many people as possible.

At first it was a struggle, without much result. But by their steady determination to find a way to reach out to the local people, they now have a large congregation, with many devotees becoming very serious about Krsna consciousness. There are programs every night at the preaching center, including a Kirtan Yoga Evening, conducted by Prema Kumara dasa, one of the first devotees who came from their preaching efforts in Bologna. There is also a cooking class one evening conducted by Krsnaloka devi dasi, a meditation class conducted by Kaliya Krsna dasa, and their weekly feast program is on Saturday, conducted by Trai Prabhu. They also go out on harinamas during the warm weather, and as many as twenty devotees participate in their harinamas.

Over eighty people, all of them from Bologna, attended the program I took part in on Saturday evening. The response was overwhelming. Not only did everyone sit and listen very attentively to the talk, but everyone danced and chanted so enthusiastically during the kirtan after the talk. I was feeling blessed to witness the wonderful results Srila Prabhupada is bestowing upon these two very sincere devotees andI simply pray that Krsna will fulfill my desire to be given the opportunity to render some little service to my dear godbrother in order to, in some small way, repay my debt for his having helped find shelter at Srila Prabhupada's lotus feet.

It was Trai Prabhu who recommended me to Srila Prabhupada to become his disciple. Srila Prabhupada wrote the following in a letter dated, May 27, 1974 to Trai Prabhu:

My dear Trai das,
Please accept my blessings. I beg to acknowledge receipt of your letter dated April 25, 1974.
Upon your recommendation I have accepted Neal Byers as my initiated disciple and his new spiritual name is Niranjana dasa. Keep him carefully now. Krsna Consciousness means to create ideal men, so you must set the example in following the rules and chanting Hare Krsna mantra and see that others are doing it also.

I always tell the devotees here that the fact that I'm still able to render some small service to Srila Prabhupada's lotus feet is testimony to the fact that Trai Prabhu has been always watching over me, keeping me carefully engaged in Srila Prabhupada's service.

Hare Krsna

data.title: Srila Prabhupada Lilamrita
data.blurb: Over the course of the last week, having found myself confined to a lying position much more than standing, walking, and especially sitting, I decided to take up a reading project. I decided to dedicate all of my reading time to readings about Srila Prabhupada.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
Over the course of the last week, having found myself confined to a lying position much more than standing, walking, and especially sitting, I decided to take up a reading project. I decided to dedicate all of my reading time to readings about Srila Prabhupada.

I first starting reading "Memories - Anecdotes of a Modern-Saint", which is a collection of interviews recorded by Siddhanta Prabhu when he decided to interview devotees for his "Remembrances of Srila Prabhupada" video series. As I was reading and very much relishing these memories, I began thinking how nice it would be to read Srila Prabhupada Lilamrita once again. So I started reading the "Memories" book and "Srila Prabhupada Lilamarita" side by side… switching back and forth between the two books over the course of the day.

I must confess that the last time I read the entire "Srila Prabhupada Lilamrita" was when each book of the seven-book series first came out during the 1980's. I had forgotten many of the details. I have a tendency to read every book about Srila Prabhupada as soon as it's published. The same thing happened when "Miracle on Second Avenue" came out a few years back by H.H. Mukunda Goswami. I was given an advance copy by the publisher in Mayapura, so I sat and read it in two days, finding myself unable to put it down. I've noticed, however, that after I finish reading a biography of Srila Prabhupada, I just think of it as a book "already read." So I don't go back and read it again. I've now discovered that tendency as a terrible mistake.

So far I've read the first two volumes of Srila Prabhupada Lilamrita along with my other readings about Srila Prabhupada. I can't begin to express how inspirational it's been for me reflect on the evolution of Srila Prabhupada's missionary spirit, beginning from his first meeting with Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati Thakur. I'm feeling so fortunate and very grateful for having such a detailed account of Srila Prabhupada's struggles and constant endeavors to serve the orders given to him by his spiritual master.

Having served in the same zone as H.H. Satsvarupa das Goswami in the early 1980's leading up to my acceptance of sannyasa from him in 1986, I'm well aware of the extent of the research both he and his assistants had to do in preparation for "Srila Prabhupada Lilamrta." So much information was unearthed about Srila Prabhupada's early years as a householder, the people who remembered him during his householder years, the people who remotely assisted him during his years just prior to accepting sannyasa, the efforts he made to work conjointly with his godbrothers for fulfilling Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati Thakur's wishes for spreading Krsna consciousness to the English-speaking world, his preaching in India, and especially his relentless commitment to writing and publishing Back to Godhead, other works, and then his three-volume translation and commentary of the First Canto of Srimad Bhagavatam completed just weeks prior to his month-long journey to the United States.

I've found myself overwhelmed with gratitude, both to Satsvarupa Maharaja and especially to Srila Prabhupada, and at the same time, immensely humbled by reflecting upon the tiny and insignificant efforts I've made in this life to spread Krsna consciousness in comparison to what Srila Prabhupada has done to expand Krsna consciousness throughout this world. In fact, I've realized that it would be an offense on my part to even attempt to make such a comparison.

I'm reminded of the purport in the Ninth Canto of Srimad Bhagavatam wherein Srila Prabhupada writes:
"Mother Ganges is worshiped by the water of the Ganges: a devotee takes a little water from the Ganges and offers it back to the Ganges. When the devotee takes the water, mother Ganges does not lose anything, and when the water is offered back, mother Ganges does not increase, but in this way the worshiper of the Ganges is benefited. Similarly, a devotee of the Lord offers the Lord patram puspam phalam toyam [Bg. 9.26] -- a leaf, flower, fruit or water -- in great devotion, but everything, including the leaf, flower, fruit and water, belongs to the Lord, and therefore there is nothing to renounce or to accept. One must simply take advantage of the bhakti process because by following this process one does not lose anything but one gains the favor of the Supreme Person." (S.B. 9.9.12)

Any little effort I've made to spread Krsna consciousness has come from Srila Prabhupada's unlimited efforts to give this whole planet Krsna consciousness… an effort which, somehow, by my incomparable fortune, captured this tiny jiva within Srila Prabhupada's loving network of Lord Caitanya's mercy. How can I compare something I've done with somebody who is completely responsible for anything good that I've done? I should not be so foolish.

While reading "Srila Prabhupada Lilamrita", I was also reminded of so many of Srila Prabhupada's early writings such as his early "Back to Godhead" magazines, which are available, going back as early as 1944, his essays published in the "Gaudiya Patrika" in 1948 and 1949 under the title "Renunciation Through Wisdom", and his "Light of the Bhagavata" which Srila Prabhupada wrote in 1961 in response to an invitation he received to attend a world conference, the Congress for Cultivating the Human Spirit, held in Japan. So many of his early writings are coming to mind that I'm making a list of them for my future readings in order to help me further capture his preaching mood in those earlier days for my own self-reflection.

I'd like to take this opportunity to encourage every one of my readers to please, please, please (that's three times for emphasis) read the whole "Srila Prabhupada Lilamrita" from cover to cover. Please don't let your life pass by without making the effort to increase your awareness and appreciation of Srila Prabhupada.

Of course, when I first thought about writing this blog, I checked to see if the full seven volume "Srila Prabhupada Lilamrita" has been translated into Russian yet. To my dismay, I discovered that, to date, only the abridged version of "Srila Prabhupada Lilamrita" has been published in Russian. So today I spoke with Bhakti Vijnana Goswami and inquired when, and if, the full version will be published in Russian. I was relieved to learn that the first volume, "A Lifetime in Preparation" will be available for distribution some time this summer. Subsequent volumes will also be coming, hopefully, soon thereafter. Please be sure to keep abreast of it's release date so that you can acquire a copy as soon as it becomes available.

Hare Krsna
