From Sri Mayapur Chandrodaya Mandir!
Date: March 4th, 2014
Speaker: HH Niranjana Swami Maharaja
Subject: C.C. Adi Lila 8.16
___________________________________________________________________________ 
HH Niranjana Swami Maharaja:
jaya jaya śri-caitanya jaya nityananda
jaya dvaita-candra jaya gaura-bhakta-vṛnda
(Call and response)
Reading today from Sri Caitanya Caritamrita, Adi Lila chapter 8, verse 16.
bahu janma kare yadi śravaṇa, kirtana
tabu ta' na paya kṛṣṇa-pade prema-dhana

(Call and response + word to word meaning)

TRANSLATION

If one is infested with the ten offenses in the chanting of the Hare Kṛṣṇa mahā-mantra, despite his endeavor to chant the Holy Name for many births, he will not get the love of Godhead that is the ultimate goal of this chanting.

PURPORT

Srila Bhaktisiddhānta Sarasvati Ṭhakur says in this connection, that although one may go on chanting the Hare Kṛṣṇa mantra for many, many years, there is no possibility of attaining the platform of devotional service unless one accepts Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu. One must follow strictly the instruction of Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu given in the Śikṣaṣṭaka (3):

tṛṇad api su-nacena taror iva sahiṣṇuna
amanina mana-dena kirtaniyaḥ sada hariḥ

[Cc. Adi 17.31]

"One should chant the Holy Name of the Lord in a humble state of mind, thinking oneself lower than the straw in the street; one should be more tolerant than a tree, devoid of all sense of false prestige, and should be ready to offer all respect to others. In such a state of mind one can chant the Holy Name of the Lord constantly." One who follows this direction, being freed from the ten kinds of offenses, becomes successful in Kṛṣṇa consciousness and ultimately reaches the platform of loving service to the Personality of Godhead.

One must come to the understanding that the Holy Name of the Lord and the Supreme Personality of Godhead Himself are identical. One cannot reach this conclusion unless one is offenseless in chanting the Holy Name. By our material calculation we see a difference between the name and the substance, but in the spiritual world the Absolute is always absolute: the name, form, qualities and pastimes of the Absolute are all as good as the Absolute Himself. Thus one is understood to be an eternal servant of the Supreme Personality of Godhead if he considers himself an eternal servant of the Holy Name and in this spirit distributes the Holy Name to the world. One who chants in that spirit, without offenses, is certainly elevated to the platform of understanding that the Holy Name and the Personality of Godhead are identical. To associate with the Holy Name and chant the Holy Name is to associate with the Personality of Godhead directly. In the Bhakti-rasamṛta-sindhu it is clearly said, sevonmukhe hi jihvadau svayam eva sphuraty adaḥ. The Holy Name becomes manifest when one engages in the service of the Holy Name. This service in a submissive attitude begins with one's tongue. Sevonmukhe hi jihvadau: One must engage his tongue in the service of the Holy Name. Our Kṛṣṇa consciousness movement is based on this principle. We try to engage all the members of the Kṛṣṇa consciousness movement in the service of the Holy Name. Since the Holy Name and Kṛṣṇa are nondifferent, the members of the Kṛṣṇa consciousness movement not only chant the Holy Name of the Lord offenselessly, but also do not allow their tongues to eat anything that is not first offered to the Supreme Personality of Godhead. The Supreme Lord declares:

patram puṣpam phalam toyam yo me bhaktya prayacchati
tad aham bhakty-upahṛtam asnami prayatatmanaḥ

"If one offers Me with love and devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit or water, I will accept it." (Bg. 9.26) Therefore the International Society for Krishna Consciousness has many temples all over the world, and in each and every temple the Lord is offered these foods. On the basis of His demands, the devotees chant the Holy Name of the Lord offenselessly and never eat anything that is not first offered to the Lord. The functions of the tongue in devotional service are to chant the Hare Kṛṣṇa mahā-mantra and eat prasādam that is offered to the Lord.

HH Niranjana Swami Maharaja:

om ajnana-timirandhasya
jnananjana-salakaya
caksur unmilitam yena
tasmai sri-gurave namah

mukam karoti vachalam
pangum langhayate girim
yat-kripa tam aham vande
shri-gurum dina-taranam

nama om visnu-padaya krsna-presthaya bhu-tale
srimate bhaktivedanta-svamin iti namine
namas te sarasvate deve gaura-vani-pracarine
nirvisesa -sunyavadi-pascatya-desa-tarine

jaya sri-krishna-chaitanya prabhu nityananda
sri-adwaita gadadhara shrivasadi-gaura-bhakta-vrinda

Hare Krsna Hare Kṛṣṇa
Kṛṣṇa Kṛṣṇa Hare Hare
Hare Rāma Hare Rāma
Rāma Rāma Hare Hare

Before I begin, I’d like to say that it is a great honor for me to be given this opportunity to render some service to all the assembled Vaishnavas today. I pray, that you’ll give me your blessings so that I may say something relevant especially since I have been asked to speak about the Holy Name, since today is the last day of our kirtan mela. The devotees have assembled here to dive deeply into the chanting of the Holy Name of the Lord. I need your blessings to say something relevant to such a deep topic. Therefore, I offer my obeisances to all my godbrothers

vancha-kalpatarubhyash cha
kripa-sindhubhya eva cha
patitanam pavanebhyo
vaishnavebhyo namo namaha

who have assembled here. Thank you very much.

In this verse, importance is stressed about chanting the Holy Name so that one can achieve the ultimate goal of this chanting. I wanted to read something also in connection to this. It is short but very relevant to this verse. In the words of our param guru Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati Thakur, in answer to the question, ‘how should we chant the Lord’s Holy Names’. I find this very relevant to myself and therefore I’ve been sharing it with many devotees and I would like to read it first and then in some way try to be able to explain the meaning behind it.

(Maharaja begins reading)
“Pure devotees do not chant the Lords Names to counteract sinful reactions, accumulate piety, attain heavenly pleasures, to mitigate famine, devastating epidemics, social unrest, disease, civil strife or to obtain wealth or an earthly kingdom. Since the Lord is the Supreme Personality of Godhead, to ask Him to fulfill our wishes is to treat Him as our servant. This is an offense. Therefore calling the Lords Names for any reason other than to attain His devotional service is useless. Jesus Christ told us not to take the Lords name in vain. However this does not mean that we do not need to always chant the Lords Names, while sleeping, awake, eating or enjoying happiness, to chant the Lords Names, begging for His service is not a useless activity, it is our only duty. But to make a show of chanting for some other purpose in other words to fulfill our own desire is useless. We should not take to the chanting of the Lords Names uselessly. We should not chant to attain religiosity, economic development, sense gratification or liberation instead we should always chant to attain the Lords service.”
(Maharaja ends reading)

I thought this was very relevant. Many times when we are sitting engaged in kirtan, engaged in japa, we try to hold on to something that we should be praying for and Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati Thakur here explains, that unless one is actually chanting for service, any other purpose, any other purpose and he gives a long list, not for social unrest, not for epidemics, not for material prosperity, any chanting to relieve distress, whether individually or collectively is materially motivated. And therefore, he uses a strong word, he says it’s useless which we may question, because sometimes we hear so many verses which explain that even once chanting the Holy Names of the Lord will eradicate all kinds of sinful reactions for millions of births. And here somebody may be chanting, collectively with a large group, for a particular purpose, yet he defines it as useless chanting. It makes me think of a verse in the Srimad Bhagavatam, in the 3rd Canto, spoken by Devahuti. She says that anyone whose work does not lead to religious life and any one whose religious, ritualistic performances do not elevate one to renunciation and anyone who is situated in renunciation that doesn’t lead to devotional service to the Supreme Lord, is to be considered to be a dead body, although breathing.

Here, in this verse, emphasis is given on the ultimate goal. Unless the ultimate goal is reached, which is the essence of today’s verse, if we want to actually achieve the ultimate goal of chanting, we have to become free from offenses. And unless the ultimate goal is achieved, which is devotional service to the Supreme Lord, any other achievement is useless. Because the only full achievement of chanting the Holy Name of the Lord, is to achieve love for the Supreme Lord. Love which is freed from all material desires.

anyabhilasita-sunyam
jnana-karmady-anavrtam

as Srila Rupa Goswami explains, that such devotional service should be freed from the influence of karma and jnana. And Srila Rupa Goswami also states that

bhukti-mukti-spṛha yavat
pisaci hṛdi vartate

He says as long as the desire for bhukti, the desire for material enjoyment, mukti, the desire for relief from suffering, liberation, as long as these two desires that are within the heart, which are considered to be like two witches, which haunt one like a ghost, then one will never be able to taste the bliss of devotional service to the Supreme Lord. And therefore it is stated in Caitanya Caritamrita that the goal of chanting is to achieve this love. And Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati Thakur here also states that to approach the Lord for something for ourselves, he says it’s an offense. We should not ask anything for ourselves. He says, therefore all these other purposes for which one chants are considered to be useless, unless we actually, purposely, with intent sit and intensely very much pray for service to the Lord. That service, that opportunity to engage in devotional service, is bestowed by the mercy of the Lord and also bestowed by the mercy of the devotee of the Lord. Therefore, in examining these statements, both here in this commentary by Srila Bhaktisiddhanta and here in Srila Prabhupadas commentary, he gives the siddha pranali, which is, that if one wants to be successful in chanting, he quotes the verse that Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati Thakur emphasizes is the siddha pranali for Gaudiya Vaishnavas which is

tṛṇad api su-nacena taror iva sahiṣṇuna
amanina mana-dena kirtaniyaḥ sada hariḥ

and Lord Caitanya Himself, has stated when explaining this verse. He says that a devotee who is engaged in the chanting of the Holy Name of the Lord, he does not retaliate, even if he is rebuked or chastised. He never retaliates or says anything to anyone else about such activity. He says, and he gives an example that, even if a tree is cut, the tree will not complain and even if the tree is drying up, it will not ask anyone for water. And He says that such forbearance must be practiced by the devotee. Thus a Vaishnava should engage in the chanting of the Holy Name of the Lord and he should never ask anyone for anything for himself. If someone offers, He will accept, but if someone doesn’t offer, he is satisfied to accept whatever comes by its own means. But then He says something very very important. He says, this type of devotional service solidly maintains, this type of behavior solidly maintains a devotees devotional service. This type of behavior. He doesn’t ask, he tolerates. So forbearing! There is a verse in the Srimad Bhagavatam,

tiraskṛta vipralabdhaḥ
saptaḥ kṣipta hata api
nasya tat pratikurvanti
tad-bhaktaḥ prabhavo 'pi hi

This verse is spoken about Parikshit Maharaja. It was spoken by Samika rishi, when he learnt that his son had garlanded a snake around Parikshit Maharajas neck. He was extremely disturbed, because he understood that Parikshit Maharaja, is such a saintly Vaishnava. In his heart he was thinking, if only Parikshit Maharaja would counteract what has happened to him by cursing my son, then that will be proper just punishment for him. But then he realised, wait a minute:

tiraskṛta vipralabdhaḥ
saptaḥ kṣipta hata api

How will it be possible? Parikshit Maharaja wouldn’t do that. Because, devotees of the Lord are so forbearing, that even if they are cheated, cursed, neglected, disturbed, insulted or even killed, they are never inclined to avenge themselves. What can I do? Parikshit Maharaja will never counter curse. I can only simply pray to the Lord, that somehow He sees the situation and He understands what needs to be done to correct the situation, because Parikshit Maharaja will never counteract or counter curse my son. Such is the characteristic of a devotee. A devotee is so forbearing. Cheated, cursed, neglected, insulted, insulted, disturbed or even killed!  But will never avenge himself. Why? Why? Because he is so forbearing, he is so tolerant! This type of devotional service, this type of mood in the chanting of the Holy Name of the Lord as Lord Caitanya Himself states, this behavior solidly maintains devotional service for the devotee. It gives him the means by which he can actually be situated in devotional service, because he is so tolerant that the Lord cannot neglect! Others may neglect, but the Lord will not neglect.  How can the Lord neglect such a devotee? He cannot neglect. He cannot turn away. Look what happened to Ambarish Maharaja?

When Ambarish Maharaja was cursed, he didn’t even pray to the Lord for protection but the Lord protected him. And when Durvasa Muni came to the Lord, first he went to Lord Brahma, he went to Lord Shiva, then he went to Lord Vishnu. Of course Brahma and Shiva they were not able to provide him relief, because that’s what he wanted, he wanted relief.  Please relieve me.  Brahma says I can’t, Lord Shiva says I can’t and then he came to Lord Vishnu, he says, “Please look at me I am suffering”.  Then Lord Vishnu says, “Sorry, I can’t do anything to help you”.

And Visvanatha Cakravarti Thakur in his commentaries to these verses, he explains the mood the Lord has in His conversation with Durvasa Muni.  When Durvasa Muni, he approaches the Lord for protection and he says, “Please can you mitigate my distress? You have invoked this chakra, certainly you can remove it”.   The Lord says, “I am sorry, I am not independent. I am completely under the control of my devotee. The devotee is always in My heart and I am always in the heart of My devotee. The devotee doesn’t think of anyone but Me and I don’t think of anyone but him”.  And then what does Durvasa Muni say? He says: “Certainly, when You see somebody suffering and they are coming to You for protection, certainly you must be inclined to feel for his suffering”.  He’s begging, “Please have a heart and the Lord says, “Sorry! Actually I can’t even think of your suffering.  I don’t have a heart and I can’t even think of your suffering”. Durvasa Muni says, “How is it possible?” And then the Lord explains, He says: “My devotee is so dear to Me. He is my devotee because He always takes me into the core of his heart and he is always praying to Me please let me engage in Your service. He doesn’t want anything else. He’s always thinking how he can serve Me. So therefore I approach My devotee and I say, please let Me give you something. But My devotee says, ‘I don’t want anything”. And the Lord says, “I want to give you something, anything”.


Just like He told Kholaveca Sridhar, he was always chanting the Holy Name of the Lord. People would complain. He said, “Kholaveca, I’ll make you a king.  I’ll give you a kingdom”. Kholaveca says: “No!  You simply be my Lord and master and let me be Your servant birth after birth”. So the Lord explains, He says, “My devotee only asks for one thing, let me serve You! So therefore, how can I give him anything, he doesn’t want? But still I must give him something. I must give him something which is valuable. Something which he’ll appreciate or value. Something that will mean something for him. He doesn’t want wealth. He doesn’t want follower. He doesn’t want beautiful women. He doesn’t want anything from me. But let me give him something that he’ll accept. So what do I give him.  I give him My heart. My devotee has my heart. And you are asking me have a heart! And I am saying, I am sorry. I don’t have one. I can’t even think. My devotee has My mind, he has My heart. You want My heart, You have to go to him”.

The Lord is so much inclined, He can’t neglect a devotee who is always fully depending upon Him. And therefore, when a devotee chants the Holy Name of the Lord in this mentality. It nourishes, it sustains, solidly maintains a devotees devotional service, so much so, that the Lord gives him the greatest benediction. Not only gives His heart, gives Himself, but He gives His devotee His devotional service, which is the means for perfection.

If one sits and meditates and chants the Holy Names of the Lord, yes, we may want to go back home back to godhead, we want to actually take shelter in the spiritual world, but actually that place can be obtained only by those who think first and foremost, service. It’s not achieved by anything else. Only if one actually has this attitude, this complete helpless dependence, ‘Oh Lord please engage me in Your service’.  Therefore we must understand that this devotional service to enter into the spiritual world can only be achieved when one actually gets the mercy of the Lord's devotee.  And therefore, it is stated by Srila Narattoma Das Thakur, he says that “When will Lord Nityananda's mercy be fully manifest to me, so that material desires will become so completely insignificant, when will that time come?” And he says, “When my mind is completely purified, completely purified, being freed from material anxieties and desires, then and only then, will I be able to understand Sri Vrindavan dham and the conjugal love of Sri Radha and Krishna and only then will my spiritual life be successful”.  

He explains that, “Yes, I have to get the mercy of the greatest servant of Lord Caitanya who is Lord Nityananda. It is Lord Nityananda who actually cleanses the heart. Gives one spiritual strength. Gives one the strength to actually become free from all these material obstacles, the desire for wealth, the desire for relief from suffering, the desire for material enjoyment”. In the Srimad Bhagavatam it is stated by Narada Muni, that the Supreme Personality of Godhead is very dear to those devotees who have no material possessions and who are fully satisfied in possessing only devotional service to the Supreme Lord.  Indeed the Lord relishes the activities of such devotees. Those who are puffed up by respectable parentage, by great opulence, by bodily beauty, they’re generally proud of possessing such things. And even if they offer the Lord worship, he says the Lord is not inclined to accept it. Why? Because they deride the devotee of the Lord. When they see the devotee, who is so fully dependent upon the mercy of the Lord, they deride the devotee. Just like Kholaveca Sridhar, the worshipers of goddess Chandi, they saw how Kholaveca Sridhar was so absorbed in chanting, but they would deride him. ‘Why don’t you worship goddess Chandi? Look at us we are wealthy, and look at you, you live in a hut, your roof, there are so many holes in it. You are crying at night, all night long with hunger pains, disturbing all your neighbors. Why don’t you take shelter?’  But what was Kholaveca Sridhar’s mood?  His mood was completely calling out the Names of the Lord. Only for one purpose, only for one purpose, to glorify the Lord, to be engaged in the service of the Lord. Such devotional service, such behavior, solidly maintains a devotees devotional service.

Lord Nityananda is very merciful and therefore as we understand, if we want to enter into the dancing party of Radha and Krsna we have to catch hold of the feet of Lord Nityananda and only then will we be qualified to enter into the spiritual world.  It is Lord Nityananda who showed by His example, how to take the order of the Supreme Lord and to tolerate all kinds of inconveniences. It was Lord Nityananda who took the order of Lord Caitanya, who told Him go out every day into the streets, and then induce others to chant Krsna's names, to tell others about Krsna, make Krsna your life and then you come back in the evening and you tell me how many people have been chanting?

What is Lord Nityananda begging for? He was begging to give others the opportunity to understand what is the real meaning of the Holy Name of the Lord and therefore His method of distribution was so glorious, so glorious that by His method of distribution He will awaken faith in others. This is what He was looking for; He was not looking for anything else.

Srila Bhaktivinoda Thakur says that when patrolman Haridas Thakur and Lord Nityananda went into the streets, They did not go out for any selfish purpose, begging for milk and rice. They simply went out for one reason, carrying the order of the Lord on their heads and begging everyone, even in the face of all kinds of adversities. Being struck in the head with a pot by Madhai, still He was so merciful. So merciful.

He was thinking that “Yes, if I can make these two personalities understand Lord Caitanya, then I will be recognized as Lord Caitanyas servant”. So it is Lord Nityananda, and the servant of Lord Nityananda who gives us the opportunity to engage in service and not only in chanting the Holy Names of the Lord, but to cleanse the heart, to purify the heart from all material anxieties and desires, so that one can be qualified to enter into Sri Vrindavan Dham. Then we’ll be able to enter into the dancing party of Radha and Krishna.  Then we’ll actually be able to approach Radha and Krishna by catching tightly, firmly holding the lotus feet of Lord Nityananda. This way we understand that we have gathered here to chant, collectively, we are chanting, praying for the opportunity to serve. That is our shelter! That is our means for perfection. That is our means for actually pleasing the Lord and becoming qualified to enter into the spiritual world and to enter that transcendental abode and thereby become qualified.

Srila Bhaktisiddhanta actually explains in the harmonist magazine, he explains something very important. Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati Thakur says that when Lord Nityananda especially favors a devotee and when He deems His devotee fit for rendering service to Srimati Radhika, He offers that devotee for Her service. Srimati Radharani is the Guru of the inner circle and Lord Nityananda, He is the Guru for the masses. It is Lord Nityananda who actually goes out to the masses and by His method of distribution awakens faith in devotional service, pure devotional service. Not by chanting the Holy Names of the Lord for relief of distress, not by chanting the Holy Names of the Lord to become free from epidemics, not by chanting the Holy Names of the Lord for elevation to the heavenly planets. By chanting the Holy Names of the Lord, His meditation was only one thing only, His meditation was service to Lord Caitanya. He did not even go out and distribute until He received the order from Lord Caitanya although He traveled on pilgrimage for 20 years, He waited until He came here, to the house of Nandan Acharya and then when He came here and received the order, then He took it up. It is the order!  That is our method of service to the Holy Name. And Srila Prabhupada explains that in today’s purport. Very important and I’ll end with this because I see a sign here that says very important, class must end by 8:45am.

Prabhupada says, “Thus one is understood to be an eternal servant of the Supreme Personality of Godhead if he considers himself an eternal servant of the Holy Name and in this spirit distributes the Holy Name to the world. One who chants in that spirit, without offenses”. Without offenses, as we said today, Srila Bhaktisiddhanta Sarasvati Thakur said any other purpose for chanting, other than for service is offensive, because it is asking something for myself. So he says, “One who chants in that spirit, without offenses, is certainly elevated to the platform of understanding that the Holy Name and the Personality of Godhead are identical. To associate with the Holy Name and chant the Holy Name is to associate with the Personality of Godhead directly”.

It is stated in the Caitanya Caritamrita that in the age of the kali the Supreme Lord appears in the form of His Holy Name. Anyone who associates with the Holy Name is as good as associating with the Lord directly and certainly he is delivered.
 

I have to end here. Thank you very much for your kind attention.

Hare Krsna!

I've been requested by Yugala Piriti dd to post the next message about a new disciple forum: 

Дорогие преданные!

Пожалуйста, примите мои поклоны. Слава Шриле Прабхупаде.

Недавно был создан форум учеников Гуру Махараджа (при его одобрении и поддержке). Этому было несколько причин, я попробую озвучить лишь одну из них, чтобы не отнимать ваше время.

Главная причина - создать своего рода архив, единое пространство, где ученики, последователи и доброжелатели Гуру Махараджа могли бы оставлять свои воспоминания о нем и о своих духовных братьях и сестрах, об их служении гуру и Кришне. Годы идут, время не щадит никого и ничего, в том числе и нашу память. Многое просто забывается. Есть вещи, которые человек даже рад позабыть, но это однозначно не относится к опыту общения с духовным учителем и вайшнавами. Как ни грустно об этом говорить, но вайшнавы тоже уходят, покидают этот мир и вместе с ними уходит то, что могло бы стать источником вдохновения для других преданных.

Этот форум - скромная попытка сохранить те сокровища, которыми владеет каждый из нас, каждый, кто принял прибежище у стоп нашего духовного учителя. И не важно, много ли у вас было личного общения или мало, это совершенно не важно. Каждый из нас может что-то сказать о своем духовном учителе, как он проявляется в нашей жизни, благодаря чему именно его мы приняли своим духовным учителем - все это может стать неисчерпаемым источником вдохновения для других преданных.

Не так давно я была на встрече учеников Шрилы Прабхупады, они рассказывали о нем, о своем общении с ним. Из 14 человек только один или двое вообще разговаривали с Прабхупадой, большинство же лишь пару раз видели его на лекциях или во время киртана. Но даже это непродолжительное общение становилось их величайшим сокровищем, которое они бережно хранили и которым не таясь делились с другими. Атмосфера во время этой встречи была совершенно непередаваемая. Нужно было видеть с какой любовью и нежностью они говорили о своем духовном учителе и духовных братьях и сестрах.

data.title: Ukraine Situation and Plans for Vyasa Puja
data.blurb: This afternoon, Madana-mohana dasa, Gaura Purnima dasa and I had a three-way conversation in order to make a decision about whether or not to conduct Vyasa Puja in Ukraine this year or not.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
This afternoon, Madana-mohana dasa, Gaura Purnima dasa and I had a three-way conversation in order to make a decision about whether or not to conduct Vyasa Puja in Ukraine this year or not.

Without going into too much detail about the current political situation in Ukraine, with regards to Vyasa Puja, it was decided that the situation in Kiev, and especially the availability of a facility in Pushcha Voditsya in May is still very unclear. Devotees want to make reservations, but it is still not possible to reserve anything in Pushcha Voditsya. Other reasonable facilities are not available at that time either.

Moreover, it's difficult to predict right now whether Kiev will be a hospitable enough environment for a festival in any place other than in the temple. It was decided that the situation might be more clear, not only in Kiev, but in other cities as well, by the end of May, since national elections are currently scheduled for late May.

Meanwhile, the Vyasa Puja organizers will be investigating whether it may be possible to hold the event in a city other than Kiev, but only after the end of May.

Therefore, for now, the Vyasa Puja has been postponed once again. We decided to set a deadline. Either the event will take place at a time and in a Ukrainian city somewhere between June 20th and July 6th, or it will not take place at all this year. A final decision will be made by early May.

Hare Krsna

data.title: Transcript from the Devotee Care Panel taken place on February 18, 2014
data.blurb: The following is an edited transcript Vrndavana Vinodini dd rendered from her notes and recordings taken at the Devotee Care panel on February 18th.
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
The following is an edited transcript Vrndavana Vinodini dd rendered from her notes and recordings taken at the Devotee Care panel on February 18th.

 

Panel presenters: HH Jayapataka Swami (JPS), HH Kavicandra Swami (KVS), HH Niranjana Swami (NRS) and HH Radhanath Swami (RNS)

Facilitator:  HG Vraja Lila dd

Question for NRS:  Devotee care begins when we feel comfortable and happy to reveal our minds in confidence.  Can you speak more on this?

NRS:  We spoke of the importance of creating a proper atmosphere for devotees to reveal their minds in confidence.  Devotees in senior positions of leadership have a great responsibility to be exemplary.  Being a good example will on its own create trust, but even more than that, it is important to control the urge to speak.  If one doesn’t control the tendency to speak then enmity arises due to speaking about others.  Anyone in a position of leadership, I can tell you, you have to hear a lot about others.  It generally makes its way to you.  Creating a culture of knowing when to speak and what to speak about others - this culture is actually a Vaisnava culture.  We should not speak unnecessarily about others.

 So what is necessary and what is unnecessary?  Bhaktivinod Thakur explains that normally when people get together they have a spontaneous inclination to speak about others.  If we don’t have sufficient attraction to speak about Krsna then it can be perverted.  Then that proclivity will erupt into spontaneous talking about other devotees.  In that talk something that is confidential or inaccurate may come out and it will break down trust in Vaisnava relationships.  When trust is broken, then the culture of trust is disrupted in whatever community we live in – locally or globally.  Due to the age we live in now, things can be spread in a moment. 

Therefore, Bhaktivinoda Thakur explains that first one must control themselves and then only can they control the whole world.  Vaco vegam manasa krodha vegam…

Question for JPS:  Jayapataka Swami has a global vision to implement facilities on how to care for devotees.  So many initiatives have been started over the world and especially in Mayapur.  Please elaborate on this vision and how can devotees can take this vision to their places?

JPS:  Of course, I can’t take much credit.  Bhaktivedanta Hospital was created by HH Radhanatha Swami.  We just asked them to make a branch here.  The hospice is still underway.  The GBC effort coordinated by Badrinarayana prabhu is making the facilities for care for devotees who have served ISKCON.

We want first of all for the culture of care to actually be established.  It is the thread in the cloth that makes the cloth stay together.  Haridas Thakur was the best example of how when he was arrested, he started the first prison preaching.  He is our saint for prison preaching.! When he was being whipped in 22 market places and Lord Caitanya sent the sudarshan chakra to chop the heads off the accusers, Haridas Thakur prayed “Please forgive them.  They do not know what they do.”  As a result Lord Caitanya took the hits of the whip on his own back.  He later showed Haridas Thakur his back which was scarred by the whip and Haridas Thakur fainted. 

Throughout ISKCON, every centre and leader can establish this culture of care.  We don’t expect every centre to have the other facilities like hospices etc.  We are discussing how every continent can have facilities.  Tirupati being a holy place, a Vaikuntha on earth, Revati Raman has some plans to build an elderly citizens asrama.  I think that HH Bhaktitirtha Swami, his idea of leaving his body in Gita Nagari was to show that these temples in the West are holy places.  That will be an ideal place to establish some facility there.  It is being discussed by local devotees.

Therefore each continent and country, depending on the size, can have some facility for devotees like hospices, asramas for elderly devotees.

In India there are websites for devotees get married.  All these things are different categories of devotee care.  In Mayapur, the hospital has two dental chairs.  For a root canal they charge 1500 rupees.  In America they charge something outrageous in the thousands.  So you can come to the festival free and get your tooth done.

That way you can save money!  <laughter>

Big countries like Brazil have many farms so they could have some facilities there.  There are many farms in the USA.  Some of these farms were visited by Srila Prabhupada.  How rare!  It is said that three miles around these places are considered to be a dham.

Question for HH RNS: Jayapataka Swami spoke this morning about a culture of care and we know that it cannot exist without love and trust.  RNS embodies this love and trust.  Please share how we can remember that this is who we are?

RNS:  Vraja lila sees everyone as a mirror of her own spiritual qualities.  On the material platform a baby trusts his mother because of the mother’s unconditional care.  Our ability to serve Krsna is rooted in Srila Prabhupada’s love for us as it has come thru his life and teachings.  That love and our trust in that love empowered us to push forward this movement. 

We may not have love but Srila Prabhupada opened the doors for us to strive for that unconditional love.  In doing so, he gave us the opportunity to engage in the 9 processes of devotional service thru our sadhana, character and thru our service we could realize that love.

It is our responsibility to be divine caretakers of his devotees thru authentically representing him thru our words and actions.  As leaders of devotional communities you can organize facilities, systems and programs to inspire and empower our devotees to be happy in Krsna Consciousness.

Bhaktivinoda Thakur said that the essence of dharma is to taste the sweetness of hari katha, serve the vaisnavas.  That is what it means to be instruments of Srila Prabhupada’s compassion – always, everywhere.

Devotee care in this sense is very foundational.  When we prioritize the hearts of each devotee and inspiring those hearts for the desire of pure devotional service, then we will truly have a culture of love and trust.

Question for HH KVS:  Isn’t all this stuff about devotee care sentimental when everything is for Krsna?  Shouldn’t the focus just be on reading, following sadhana etc?

KVS: There is kanistha, madhyama and uttama adhikari.  We heard this morning that Krsna loves to take care of his devotees so if we don’t follow in his footsteps then we can’t be with Krsna.  If we are chanting and reading properly, then we would naturally want others to do that.  We all need help to follow the program.  Charity begins at home.  It’s not sentimental in the mundane sense.  We need help to take care of ourselves.  In order to practice, we need to take care of devotees.

Question for all panelists:  When temples are small its easier to provide devotee care.  How can we maintain care when temples grow bigger?

RNS:  If we as leaders really care, if we appreciate how Krsna and Srila Prabhupada really care, then whether we are big or small we will find the way to create the systems for devotee care.  Srila Prabhupada would say impossible is a word in a fools dictionary.  Nothing is impossible if we have the desire.  It may be impossible for you and me, but it’s not impossible for Krsna.  When we really care about others’ spiritual lives and every aspect of their life that is important for the sustainability of their spiritual life, then Krsna personally thru our parampara empowers us. 

To really be an instrument and deeply transform people’s hearts, we need to really care about people.  That’s what Srila Prabhupada taught us.  If we do, then beyond all of our limitations, Krsna will definitely empower us to do great things.  Purity is the force.  Srila Prabhupda wanted us to make the whole world Krsna Consciousness.  That’s more than just a lot of devotees in a temple.  Srila Prabhupada taught that if we just surrender with humility and compassion, "We could actually make the whole world Krsna conscious in 18 days."

JPS:  I was thinking about why this person thought a small temple was better at devotee care.  It must be because the leader of his temple was giving care nicely and when the temple grew larger he couldn’t cover everyone.  In order to be successful he would have to empower others and see that many are giving care.  Ideally, as Radhanath Swami said everyone should take on responsibility for giving care.

The aspect of giving care as we mentioned earlier is that we want to establish a culture of devotee care.  I remember when we started in Mayapur we had 5 devotees and now we have 5000.  It’s certainly beyond me to keep track of all devotes.  That’s why I’m always spending my time encouraging other leaders to be sensitive and care giving.  This is the challenge in ISKCON of appreciating each devotees.  We hear about this in the 3rd verse of Siksastakam – amanina manadena – don’t expect respect for yourself but give appreciation to all others.  If that can be followed, then we would have no problems.

NRS:  I discussed this in the very beginning of “Taking Care of Krsna’s Devotees” when I was nourished in a small temple and being cared for by my temple president who would tell me something about Srila Prabhupada.  That type of care can easily be lost when the temple grows if the leader changes his priorities.  As Jayapataka Swami just said and I would just have to repeat, the priority should always be consistent.  If you are caring for a few devotees in a small group then the natural result of being cared for is wanting to reciprocate.  “Let me offer something in return to that person who cared for me in taking responsibility of caring for others the same way I was cared for.”  In this way a temple can grow exponentially.  Therefore, if the leaders are responsible for keeping the vision always the same – the primary resource is ALWAYS devotees.  Everything else is secondary.  Only then the project will naturally grow in a very organic way and these principles will not be lost.

KVS:  I was thinking that the mood could be there that bigger is better because you have so many more people who can take care.  We see this even in big families that so many people can help you out in day-to-day life.  If that mood is there then it is actually more personal.

Question For RNS:  I have experienced that devotees lose trust in a leader and they are very verbal about it. What would you advise such a devotee to help them trust leaders?

RNS: Trust is a natural expression of the heart.  It is not something that can be superimposed upon someone.  If one does not have trust in a particular leader, in a Vaisnava culture, unless they are doing something bad, we should respect them.  Vaisnava culture is one of respect even if we do not trust someone.  We can still respect from a distance, respect seniority.  This is something that is really challenging our movement when people say something about anyone at any time.  Bhakti cannot flourish in such a setting.  For example, even if our parents do not follow the four regulative principles, we should still respect them.  If we do not have trust in a particular leader, then we put trust in a leader we can trust.  Losing trust in a particular person is not the end of our spiritual life.  It’s like an electrical current – if that electrical outlet doesn’t provide that energy we need, then we go to another.

For KVS:  How to balance caring and chastising while teaching devotee children and teenagers in Sridham Mayapur?

KVS: Better to be unbalanced and be much more caring.  Children or anybody learn by example.  So if we are chastising them too much then they will chastise the next person down the line.  Of course sometimes we need to correct sometimes but it should be done with love.  Attitude is everything.  We can feel it when someone is correcting out of love and not out of envy.  I remember one Mother told me that she couldn’t control her kids and I said, “We are not supposed to control our children but ourselves, anger and mind.”  <laughter>  Usually one is chastised when one is angry.  If we really care, we should take time and guide them and explain to them the reasons.

Question for NRS: If a devotee feels he needs care what is the proper way to request it?  What is the best way to take the first step?

NRS:  The best way to request is to submissively reveal his mind to another devotee and the responsibility of the devotee who he is speaking to is to hear him.  Sometimes that’s a major endeavor.  Our minds go racing to different things that we are already ready to offer an objection or suggestion.  But submissive inquiry is the essence.  Submission means to quell the mind and hear very carefully the words that are coming from the person we reveal our minds to, deeply praying for guru and Krsna to reveal themselves through their words.

Question for JPS:  Srila Prabhupada in his various books, letters etc has given us so much about devotee care.  Why was this important aspect not given importance in our movement after Srila Prabhupada’s departure?  As a result we’ve lost so many devotees due to a lack of care.  At least now this area is being given importance and the GBC should ensure it is being implemented in all temples.  Is there a system of devotee care for those sannyasis who are falling?

JPS:  I hear two questions and one request.  One question is why this wasn’t implemented in the past.  The ability to give care is transcendental and in mode of goodness. At the time of Srila Prabhupada’s departure it seemed that the focus was more on expansion. Devotee care got low priority. Now the GBC has taken this on as a major initiative and they made a permanent devotee care committee. Maybe it will get transformed into a ministry later. As far as leaders getting care, especially those going through difficulties, this is an issue that we’ve tried to push that these are Maharatis or Ratis, and somehow they get wounded in battle. When we see the war of Kuruksetra, we see how they received care. The charioteer would drive to the side and arrange for someone to provide medical health. Then when they get better, they felt like ‘Why did you take me out?! Let me fight!’ So we can take inspiration from RNS’s point that Srila Prabhuapda declared war on maya – and she won’t go without a fight! This is 10000 years! Our fight is drums, kartals and Hare Krsna!

Krsna is more powerful than kali. Lord Caitanya and Nitai’s mercy is more powerful than kali. Certainly if we need to have a program for our leaders in case they have some difficulty that they get up and join the fight again because we need them. This is a fight to the finish! And kali will be finished for 10,000 years!

To really be an instrument and deeply transform people’s hearts, we need to really care about people.  That’s what Srila Prabhupada taught us.  If we do, then beyond all of our limitations, Krsna will definitely empower us to do great things.  Purity is the force.  Srila Prabhupda wanted us to make the whole world Krsna Consciousness.  That’s more than just a lot of devotees in a temple.  Srila Prabhupada taught that if we just surrender with humility and compassion, "We could actually make the whole world Krsna conscious in 18 days."

JPS:  I was thinking about why this person thought a small temple was better at devotee care.  It must be because the leader of his temple was giving care nicely and when the temple grew larger he couldn’t cover everyone.  In order to be successful he would have to empower others and see that many are giving care.  Ideally, as Radhanath Swami said everyone should take on responsibility for giving care.

The aspect of giving care as we mentioned earlier is that we want to establish a culture of devotee care.  I remember when we started in Mayapur we had 5 devotees and now we have 5000.  It’s certainly beyond me to keep track of all devotes.  That’s why I’m always spending my time encouraging other leaders to be sensitive and care giving.  This is the challenge in ISKCON of appreciating each devotees.  We hear about this in the 3rd verse of Siksastakam – amanina manadena – don’t expect respect for yourself but give appreciation to all others.  If that can be followed, then we would have no problems.

NRS:  I discussed this in the very beginning of “Taking Care of Krsna’s Devotees” when I was nourished in a small temple and being cared for by my temple president who would tell me something about Srila Prabhupada.  That type of care can easily be lost when the temple grows if the leader changes his priorities.  As Jayapataka Swami just said and I would just have to repeat, the priority should always be consistent.  If you are caring for a few devotees in a small group then the natural result of being cared for is wanting to reciprocate.  “Let me offer something in return to that person who cared for me in taking responsibility of caring for others the same way I was cared for.”  In this way a temple can grow exponentially.  Therefore, if the leaders are responsible for keeping the vision always the same – the primary resource is ALWAYS devotees.  Everything else is secondary.  Only then the project will naturally grow in a very organic way and these principles will not be lost.

KVS:  I was thinking that the mood could be there that bigger is better because you have so many more people who can take care.  We see this even in big families that so many people can help you out in day-to-day life.  If that mood is there then it is actually more personal.

Question For RNS:  I have experienced that devotees lose trust in a leader and they are very verbal about it. What would you advise such a devotee to help them trust leaders?

RNS: Trust is a natural expression of the heart.  It is not something that can be superimposed upon someone.  If one does not have trust in a particular leader, in a Vaisnava culture, unless they are doing something bad, we should respect them.  Vaisnava culture is one of respect even if we do not trust someone.  We can still respect from a distance, respect seniority.  This is something that is really challenging our movement when people say something about anyone at any time.  Bhakti cannot flourish in such a setting.  For example, even if our parents do not follow the four regulative principles, we should still respect them.  If we do not have trust in a particular leader, then we put trust in a leader we can trust.  Losing trust in a particular person is not the end of our spiritual life.  It’s like an electrical current – if that electrical outlet doesn’t provide that energy we need, then we go to another.

For KVS:  How to balance caring and chastising while teaching devotee children and teenagers in Sridham Mayapur?

KVS: Better to be unbalanced and be much more caring.  Children or anybody learn by example.  So if we are chastising them too much then they will chastise the next person down the line.  Of course sometimes we need to correct sometimes but it should be done with love.  Attitude is everything.  We can feel it when someone is correcting out of love and not out of envy.  I remember one Mother told me that she couldn’t control her kids and I said, “We are not supposed to control our children but ourselves, anger and mind.”  <laughter>  Usually one is chastised when one is angry.  If we really care, we should take time and guide them and explain to them the reasons.

Question for NRS: If a devotee feels he needs care what is the proper way to request it?  What is the best way to take the first step?

NRS:  The best way to request is to submissively reveal his mind to another devotee and the responsibility of the devotee who he is speaking to is to hear him.  Sometimes that’s a major endeavor.  Our minds go racing to different things that we are already ready to offer an objection or suggestion.  But submissive inquiry is the essence.  Submission means to quell the mind and hear very carefully the words that are coming from the person we reveal our minds to, deeply praying for guru and Krsna to reveal themselves through their words.

Question for JPS:  Srila Prabhupada in his various books, letters etc has given us so much about devotee care.  Why was this important aspect not given importance in our movement after Srila Prabhupada’s departure?  As a result we’ve lost so many devotees due to a lack of care.  At least now this area is being given importance and the GBC should ensure it is being implemented in all temples.  Is there a system of devotee care for those sannyasis who are falling?

JPS:  I hear two questions and one request.  One question is why this wasn’t implemented in the past.  The ability to give care is transcendental and in mode of goodness. At the time of Srila Prabhupada’s departure it seemed that the focus was more on expansion. Devotee care got low priority. Now the GBC has taken this on as a major initiative and they made a permanent devotee care committee. Maybe it will get transformed into a ministry later. As far as leaders getting care, especially those going through difficulties, this is an issue that we’ve tried to push that these are Maharatis or Ratis, and somehow they get wounded in battle. When we see the war of Kuruksetra, we see how they received care. The charioteer would drive to the side and arrange for someone to provide medical health. Then when they get better, they felt like ‘Why did you take me out?! Let me fight!’ So we can take inspiration from RNS’s point that Srila Prabhuapda declared war on maya – and she won’t go without a fight! This is 10000 years! Our fight is drums, kartals and Hare Krsna!

Krsna is more powerful than kali. Lord Caitanya and Nitai’s mercy is more powerful than kali. Certainly if we need to have a program for our leaders in case they have some difficulty that they get up and join the fight again because we need them. This is a fight to the finish! And kali will be finished for 10,000 years!

data.title: Here, at the ISKCON Leadership Sanga (ILS)
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
I've been attending the ISKCON Leadership Sanga (ILS) since arriving in Mayapura on February 15th evening. Since I do not have so much time to explain what the ILS is, those of you who can read English can find more information about the sanga at  www.ils.iskcon.org.

Although I did not prepare any particular presentation for the ILS, I was unexpectedly asked to give two short presentations about devotee care on "Devotee Care Day" (February 18th, 2014). I was also asked to participate in a question and answer discussion on devotee care on that same evening. For that particular event, all eight hundred ILS participants came to hear answers from Radhanath Maharaja, Jayapataka Maharaja, Kavicandra Maharaja and myself, to the questions Vrajalila devi dasi asked as facilitator of the event. Additional questions were also submitted by the ILS attendees. At the end, we were asked to distribute prasadam to all the attendees. Naturally, I distributed the mahaprasadam with great relish.

I also found myself sitting in on the presentations about the "ISKCON's Lines of Authority" paper. Having authored the paper in cooperation with the members of the Lines of Authority committee, I felt it would be best to be present as well as available for answering questions after the Powerpoint presentations Bhanu Maharaja gave on behalf of the committee. As expected, there were some challenging questions from devotees from both sides of the issue.

In response to one challenging question, I found myself explaining that whatever authority we repose our faith in within ISKCON, on our journey to the lotus feet of Radha Krsna we must all pass through a region which necessitates surrender to Srila Prabhupada's desires for us to cooperate within his mission. I then suggested that for any true follower of Srila Prabhupada, there was simply no way around that.

With that understanding, I explained that it behooved everyone within Srila Prabhupada's mission to establish our faith in those who inspire us to chant the Holy Names in a humble state of mind, thinking ourselves lower than the straw in the street, devoid of all sense of false prestige, and ready to offer all respect to others. In that state of mind, we can be successful in our spiritual endeavors no matter with whom we find ourselves in a position of having to cooperate. Of course, there was more detail to my answer, but while giving my answer, I noticed how the facial expression of the devotee who had asked the challenging question changed from frustration to acceptance upon hearing my answer. I asked him if he was satisfied with my answer, to which he gave a definitive, "Yes."

Yesterday I also attended Devamrita Maharaja's presentation about preaching in first world countries and the importance of being sensitive to the modern Westerner's need for empathy and compassion. I found the presentation very relevant and insightful, and especially an important message for leaders worldwide to hear.

Presentations are continuing today and tomorrow, but this morning I had some important matters to deal with in relation to visas and future travel. So I took a few hours off this morning to deal with that as well as to write a few words for this blog.

Hare Krsna

data.title: Chowpatty, Kirtan Mela, Govardhana Eco-Village, and my Association with several Godbrothers and Godsisters
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
I arrived in Mumbai very early on the morning of February 6th. Having flown all night from Istanbul, I was tired and therefore had to rest a good part of the day on February 6th. Nonetheless, I was able to spend a good part of the afternoon with Radhanath Maharaja. We spent quite some time talking about many topics, as we usually do, and then we planned the next several days that I would be here in Chowpatty.

On February 8th and 9th there was a Kirtan Mela here in Mumbai, organized by one recently-married devotee who had previously lived in the Chowpatty brahmacari asrama. A large hall was rented, and various kirtaniyas were invited to participate in the event. Having learned that I was in Chowpatty, I was also requested to take part. So I spent some of the time on those two days with Radhanath Maharaja and the rest of the time I spent at the Kirtan Mela.

On February 9th, Radhanath Maharaja gave SB class in the morning, and I was asked to give the Sunday Feast lecture, accompanied by three other disciples of Srila Prabhupada. I was asked to speak first, so I tried my best to set the tone of the program around Srila Prabhupada, thus encouraging my godbrother and two godsisters, all of whom had personal association with Srila Prabhupada, to share their realizations of his glories. It turned out to be a wonderful program, which seemed to be very inspiring for all who participated, including myself.

After the Sunday program we all took lunch together, and then we were invited to Krsnacandra Prabhu's home for more association with each other in the evening. We all shared more stories about Srila Prabhupada, about Yamuna dd (since both godsisters were very close to her), and also some stories of the early days in New Vrndavana, since also present was my godbrother, Kuladri Prabhu, who was the Temple President of New Vrndavana for so many years. He was also Radhanath Maharaja's Temple President during the time when Maharaja was a brahmacari in New Vrndavana. Both of them had quite a few stories to share about the early days of New Vrndavana.

Early this morning, I left Chowpatty to Govardhana Eco-Village, the Chowpatty farm project about 100 kilometers outside of Mumbai. Kuladri Prabhu and I were invited to take part in the inauguration of the "Yamuna Project." The Yamuna Project will be a replica of the Yamuna River, which will be established right there in the Govardhana Eco-Village. Along with the Yamuna River will also be Govardhana, all the forests of Vrndavana, and also seven main temples of Vrndavana, something very similar to that which was envisioned by Srila Prabhupada for the New Vrndavana project in the United States.

After a two-hour drive from Mumbai, Kuladri Prabhu and I arrived at approximately 8:00 AM. We were very graciously received and we were then asked to speak to the devotees. I gave class from the verse which was on the board for this morning's class, and then Kuladri Prabhu shared some of his realizations about rural community living as was envisioned by Srila Prabhupada and which Srila Prabhupada personally shared with Kuladri Prabhu.

Kuladri Prabhu and I are also friends from the early days, so it was a wonderful opportunity for me to spend time with him and to share our memories of the times we were together in New Vrndavana in the 1970's.

Since I have a flight to Coimbatore early tomorrow morning, I returned to Chowpatty shortly after lunch. Kuladri Prabhu will remain in Govardhana Eco-Village tonight to share some more stories with the more than seventy devotees who are currently living there, working very hard to realize Radhanath Maharaja's vision for the project.

Very soon, the lectures I gave in Chowpatty and in Govardhana Eco-Village will be posted, as well as a few video clips of the ground-breaking ceremony which I took part in this morning.

Also the video of the Sunday Feast Lecture I gave can be found by clicking here:

Hare Krsna

Body_raw.value:
I know that there are many devotees who are eager to gain access to all that this site offers. However, I've noticed lately that it's becoming more difficult for me to provide material for the site. I definitely have no plans to discontinue. But if I could get more help gathering good quality audio files, video files, and photos it would be very welcome. I will explain….

First, however, I must say that I'm very grateful for all the help that I'm already getting with this site and I wrote about that in the acknowledgements of my new book, "Lectures from a Disciple – Volume 3" (which, by the way, has already been printed in English and should be available for distribution very soon).

The problem is, as easy as it may seem, it's not always convenient for me to set up a recorder to record my own lectures (and kirtans) every time I speak or lead kirtan. Moreover, from time to time I hear complaints about the quality of the recordings.

I definitely appreciate the need for better recordings. But if it's inconvenient for me to set up a recorder and to try to get the right settings for the unique recording conditions in each place that I speak, just imagine how much more inconvenient it would be for me to set up separate microphones for myself and my translator prior to beginning my talk. It requires setup time, and most of the time I just don't have that opportunity before speaking. 

Ideally these arrangements should be done before I arrive for the lecture. Moreover, they should be done by somebody who knows how to make a proper recording. For instance, when recording in a large room or hall with a sound system, putting an mp3 recorder or a mobile phone before the speaker and translator, or next to the sound system, is not going to make a very high quality recording. History has proven this true.

Another point… When devotees do make audio or video recordings, and sometimes even better recordings than what I have, or if they take photographs of the event, it's usually not so easy for me to chase them down to ask them for copies so that the files can be uploaded onto the site. Also Madana-mohana is not always with me to do the chasing.

Therefore if devotees could become more conscientious of these requirements, and especially if there are devotees capable of providing high quality material (i.e. photographs taken by somebody who knows a little bit about photography, or audio files by somebody who actually knows how to make clear recordings) it would be very helpful if Madana-mohana and I could get help gathering this material.

There is not even any need to directly hand us the material. If you can, that's best. But all we really need to know right away is what material you have and that you will be able to upload it soon.

The site administrators have recently added a new upload section on the site where any file (up to three gigabytes) can be uploaded directly to them. These new upload links can now be found by either clicking on the "File Share" tab at the top of the home page, or by clicking on "read more…." under "Become a contributor to NRS Fileshare" on the left side of the home page.

Thank you very much.

Hare Krsna

data.title: My Visit to the Hungarian Leadership Retreat
data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
The past several days I was in the Eastern part of Hungary attending a leadership retreat with Sivarama Maharaja and approximately forty-five senior devotees from the Hungarian yatra. It was the first retreat of it's kind for the Hungarian yatra, but based on the outpourings from the participants during the closing statements of the event, it seems as though it will definitely not be the last one. From what I heard, they are already planning their next one. The main purpose of the event was to bring the senior devotees together to associate with each other and to focus on Srila Prabhupada's mood, instructions, and legacy.

I was involved in the retreat mainly because my visit to Hungary during those dates was unexpected. I was originally planning to come to Hungary in early February, but there were some last-minute changes to my schedule which brought me here several days earlier. A few days before my arrival, I asked Sivarama Maharaja if he and the other leaders would mind if I also took part.  Maharaja warmly welcomed me and replied, "Basically my goal is to submerge these devotees as much in Srila Prabhupada as possible. Your help in any way in this regard would be greatly appreciated."

So when I arrived in Hungary, I was picked up at the airport, brought briefly to the temple to drop off some of my things, and within a couple of hours I was on a three-hour train ride to Eastern Hungary with Sivarama Maharaja and his assistant, Syama Bihari dasa. All the participants stayed at a simple hotel which the devotees rented for the event.

The elements of the retreat were:

1. Kirtana
2. Japa
3. Class
4. Discussion
5. Debate
6. Questions and Answers
7. Bhajan
8. Gift giving
9. Getting to know each other

Srila Prabhupada gave Srimad Bhagavatam class every morning (except on the last morning I was asked to give the Bhagavatam class). After Srila Prabhupada's class, Sivarama Maharaja discussed the class and answered questions.

Since the event was in Hungarian (except for the group readings I had with the English-speaking devotees), I did not answer that many of the questions after class, but those which I did answer will be posted on the site in separate audio files. Some photos will also be posted in the "Photos" section.

Hare Krsna

Hare Krsna

Last weekend I spent two days in Radhadesh at the "Radhadesh Mellows" kirtan festival. It was the first time I had been in Radhadesh since 1991, when I spent three months in Belgium and Holland on an assignment given to me by the GBC Body. I was very pleased to see such a large gathering of devotees at this event.

I also had the opportunity to spend some time with Bada Haridasa Prabhu, which is always a relishable experience for me.

Anandini devi dasi, a disciple from Belgium, who came to Krsna consciousness around the same time I was there in 1991, is now living in Radhadesh. She had been living in the United States for quite some time, but relocated to Radhadesh a couple of years ago to cultivate the French-speaking people, since many devotees in Radhadesh do not speak the local language.

I had the wonderful opportunity to meet many of the people Anandini has reached out to while living in Radhadesh. On both days, I met with small groups of them in Anandini's flat and got the opportunity to learn a little about each of them and how they were connected to the Radhadesh community through Anandini's outreach programs. It was an informal gathering, but they were all very gracious and eager to hear whatever little I was able to share with them.

I also had the opportunity to take lunch with two of the local leaders on Sunday. They asked a lot of questions about devotee care and gave me the opportunity to share whatever little realizations I've been able to gain on this important topic.

A few photos of my visit have been posted in the Photo Section here on the site.

Hare Krsna

data.author: Niranjana Swami

Body_raw.value:
This morning I received information that due to the ongoing civil unrest in Kiev, the Ukrainian government has mobilized police from all over the country into Kiev and is housing them in resorts and camps throughout the city. All of these camps, including the venue for this year's Vyasa Puja, have been given orders from the government to not utilize their facilities for any purpose other than housing these police. It is unknown how long this order will remain in effect.

Gaura Purnima dasa will be writing a more detailed announcement which will be posted in Russian and in English in upcoming days. However, in the meantime, considering how close it is to the date of the scheduled Vyasa Puja in Kiev on January 6-7, I just wanted to get the word out that the Vyasa Puja is postponed and will be rescheduled for some time in May.

If you have questions, please do not post them here. There will be no answers given. I have requested Gaura Purnima dasa to provide a detailed explanation, which will hopefully include answers to any questions which may arise.

Hare Krsna

Devotees may be wondering why there's been such a long lapse since my last blog. Between Taiwan, Almaty, Kiev, and then my flight to the United States, I was not able to find the right opportunity to write. After arriving in the United States, I then flew to Florida to spend time with my godbrother, Guru Gauranga Prabhu.

I'm currently staying in the East Hartford temple and for the most part, I plan to remain here until the end of the year.

I'm always hesitant to write about my health. However, since I often need to explain why I must cancel travel plans or why I cannot accept invitations to visit so many places, the health factor, more often than not, appears in my explanations. Hence, I've decided that I must once again write something about my health.

When I was in Almaty, I had to go through another series of tests in order to ascertain the current condition of my gastrointestinal tract organs. The gastroenterologist was pleased to report that the most serious area of concern, which he had noted from my previous tests done in August, showed significant signs of improvement. He attributed the improvements to the medication he put me on back in August. When I tried to suggest that the three weeks I spent in the South Indian clinic might have also contributed to the improvements, he dismissed my suggestion. I was not so convinced, but that is not what is most important.

I often quote from Srimad Bhagavatam (7.9.19) "… embodied souls neglected and not cared for by You (Lord Nrsimhadeva) cannot do anything for their betterment." Srila Prabhupada writes in his commentary to that verse, "… unless one is protected by the mercy of the Lord, no remedial measure can act effectively. One should consequently depend fully on the causeless mercy of the Lord. Although as a matter of routine duty one must of course accept other remedial measures, no one can protect one who is neglected by the Supreme Personality of Godhead."

The point is that it is ultimately Krsna who decides. As a matter of duty, we make the endeavor but leave all decisions up to Him.

In this connection, I am currently making another endeavor. The specialist warned me that there is still another issue which requires attention. The next point of focus, which he listed as #1 priority for me now, is that I must exercise. Not only is exercise essential for helping to reduce high blood pressure, but I also have a liver condition which needs to be reversed. According to his claim, which has been confirmed by several other reliable sources, there is no medicine for reversing it better than exercise.

From August until November, I did not have facility to engage in any substantial exercise. I therefore decided that I better use this opportunity for exercising which is available to me right now. The earliest I would have another opportunity to do something like this would be some time in April.

In addition to my usual back exercises, which I'm doing every morning while I listen to class, I'm spending two to three hours every morning exercising on cardio machines. The owner of a fitness club nearby was kind enough to provide me full access to these machines any time that I wanted for the whole month of December. I decided to go early in the morning because I'm the only person there at that time. Even the owner is usually not there until 10:00 AM.

This facility just appeared to me, practically without any effort at all.  It was the first place I visited when I arrived in Hartford in early December. I went there, spoke to the owner, told him my needs, and within minutes he offered this facility to me.

I accepted it as Krsna's arrangement and that's why I've decided to cancel most of my other commitments this month. From all indications, judging from the way I currently feel, I believe that it was the right decision. It is my sincere hope, that in the long run, the efforts I'm making now to focus on these (and other) health issues, will enable me to maintain a reasonable level of travel in the upcoming year.

Hare Krsna
